1.18: I have this battle under control!

1.21: Nya?! T-this much damage won't stop me...!
1.22: I hope... I helped... a bit... gh... nya... ...
1.23: Praise me more and more! I grow more when I get praised~ Ehehehe...

The first Imperial Navy destroyer to be
loaded with the powerful large-type 61cm
torpedoes, Mutsuki! While I'm an old model,
I gave it my all on the frontlines!

1.4: Are you that interested in me~? Ehehehe...
1.5: A new ship girl appears! Ta-da~!

1.7: Reporting in that the operation is complete!
1.8: Oh? It looks like a letter has arrived.

1.EarlySummer 6547: Oyoyo? It's almost summer time, nya? Kisaragi-chan, for this year's summer vacation, what should we do? I will~, I will~!
1.Rainy 6547: Kisaragi-chan, it's been raining a lot recently. Ah, let's make some teru teru bozus! One for Kisaragi-chan and one for me!
1.Summer 6547: Oyo? Admiral, you're going for a dip in the water, nya? I'm coming, too! Swimsuit, swimsuit!

10.10: I'm happy...! Thank you very much...!

100.1: Light cruiser, Tama.\nI'm not a cat, meow.

Tama nya. I did my duty as a torpedo

101.1: I'm Kiso. I'll bestow upon you\nthe absolute best victory.

5500 ton light cruiser, Kuma-class 'Kiso'.

I don't need those. Battle is all about
bringing it right to the enemy! Right?

101.9: Seaplanes? Don't need that sort of thing.

101.Summer 6547: Summer, huh? Well, this season isn't too bad. You planning to go to the sea? Well?

102.1: I'm Chitose. I'm the the first Japanese\nseaplane tender. Nice to meet you!
102.10: Ah, fix it right there. Yeah, there. I want to be more useful.
102.11: With only this much... I'll be better soon.
102.12: Since Chiyoda will worry about me, I'll heal up as fast as possible.

102.25:
I'm the Seaplane Tender, Chitose.
Although I'm an exceptional ship
capable of making use of seaplanes a lot,
I was used as an oiler and supplied fuel to
other ships. In the latter stages of the war,
I was remodeled into an aircraft carrier and
fought in the frontlines.
102.28: Admiral, it's not good to work yourself too hard. Once in a while, won't you drink some fine sake with me, and have a little rest? Alright...?
102.29: You're busy aren't you? That's fine, that's fine. How about we take it easy?
102.3: You want some more? Here you go!
102.4: Admiral~ you can really knock them back! Here, another drink!
102.5: Umm, it looks like a new ship has arrived.
102.8: Admiral, there's a message for you.
102.NotFall 1471: That's right. In fall, drinking sake while eating makes it taste even better.

102.NotFall 6547: Summer is already over, and the fall has arrived.

106.44: It's 2 P.M. Ah.. Admiral, I see Chiyoda over there! He~y Chiyoda~?

106.46: It's 4 P.M. Admiral, this evening's maneuvers, what are you considering?
106.47: 5 P.M. Such a beautiful twilight, isn't it?
106.49: 7 P.M. Just time for dinner, no? How about we go to Houshou's?
106.5: Umm, it looks like a new ship has arrived.
106.50: 8 P.M. Admiral, how about taking your time in a bath today?
106.51: 9 P.M. Admiral, the bath is.... going together is impossible!

106.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, staying up late every day is bad. Go to bed early today...

107.33: 3 A.M. To call on the admiral hourly... seriously, what kind of mission is this?

126.1: I'm I-168. What? It's hard to say? OK,\njust call me Imuya. Nice to meet you!

126.12: This wound is nothing serious! ...D...don't make it too sore...

126.23: I did it! You can rely on Imuya, the sniper of the sea! I'll even finish off aircraft carriers!
126.24: Commander, I can dive to about 100m. Won't you come dive with me this time? I, will guide you with all my strength. When this fight is over... it's a promise, okay?

I am a submarine born and raised in Kure.
After that battle of Midway, I managed to
land the final blow to Yorktown who
defeated Hiryuu! Our carriers were avenged!
I also worked hard running transport
missions to that terrible island.
126.28: Commander, let's take a break if you are tired.

126.35: 0500. Eh, did you want to hear Imuya's voice?
126.36: 0600. Commander, it's morning before you knew it!
126.38: 0800. I'm pretty strong in the morning, you know!
126.39: 0900. Let's get to work let's get to work!

126.41: 1100. If we work hard I'm sure there will be delicious lunch waiting for us!
126.43: 1300. Lunch with the commander, I'm really happy!

126.49: 1900. I can only make curry, is that okay? Alrighty, let's make it together! We can eat together in an hour!
126.5: A new ship has been created! I wonder what kind of ship it is?
126.50: 2000. Did you make the curry properly? Well then, let's eat together!
126.51: 2100. Somehow after eating dinner and getting full, I get sleepy...
126.53: 2300. Commander, thanks for another day's hard work!

126.Rainy 6547: It's been raining a lot recently, hasn't it? It's the rainy season, so it can't be helped. Ah, Iku! So you're making a teru teru bozu! Show me, show me! ...That's very unique.

I have fought hard from the beginning to
the end. Even when the war had become
harsh, I managed to take down that heavy
cruiser! After fulfilling my mission and
everything was all over, I managed to make
it back safely to Kure, my home port.
127.28: Do your best with your KanColle study!

127.38: 0800. What kind of day will today be, I wonder?

127.40: A~dmiral. 1000. I'd like a new swimsuit soon~

127.43: 1300. Ah, Admiral, why don't we take a nap?

128.11: May I entrust you with the servicing?

I made it to Germany as the second
submarine sent on the transoceanic voyage.

was carried out 5 times, but because of
mines and other events, I was the only
one who was able to successfully complete
the return trip... yeah, I really hate mines!
128.29: I think... I'd like to read a new book now...

128.33: 0300. If you keep going now, you wont last through tomorrow. Admiral?

128.40: 1000. It's time to refocus on my reading!
128.41: 1100. Once, I gave Hibiki some freshly baked bread, and she was so happy! What a good kid...!
128.43: 1300. Let's keep on reading, shall I?
128.44: It feels refreshing to not be submerged.
128.45: 1500. I'm a bit distracted, so I can't focus on reading....
128.46: 1600. Admiral, what do you usually do around this time?
128.47: 1700. What should I make for dinner..?
128.48: 1800. I really like the atmosphere the sun setting over the sea creates.

128.53: It's 2300. It's getting late, isn't it. I'm a bit tired...

128.Summer 6547: It's summer. Acht-acht! It's already August and we haven't gone swimming together. Ah, Hacchan goes swimming every day, of course. Would you like to go swimming, too?

13.1: Nice to meet you.\nI'm Ayanami, a special class destroyer.

13.11: Please let me rest for a bit...

Special class destroyer, Ayanami.
I'm the first ship of the improved
Fubuki class. In the Third Battle of the
Solomon Sea, I showed an outstanding
performance as a destroyer.

famous Malaya, Midway, Solomon and

to Japan at the end however...

131.1: First of the Yamato-class battleships,\nYamato. Heading forth!
131.11: I'm going to the bath for a bit.
131.12: Ow-w-w. I'm sorry, I didn't expect they'd get me that badly~
131.15: Yeah, let's go! Naval battle, ready!
131.16: First and second cannons, volley fire, start!
131.17: Bracket, huh... Yes, the next shot will be a direct hit.
131.19: D-did you think you got a direct hit?
131.20: I'm starting to list... ballast pumps, hurry!
131.21: I-in such a place... Yamato... will not sink!
131.22: Again... I pass away... all hands... top deck... Musashi... Shinano... I leave the rest to you...
131.23: Yamato is number one? I'm a bit proud of myself. Leave the next sortie to me!
131.24: Admiral, as always, thank you. The duty of being the flagship of the combined fleet, shooting at the enemy ships; everything pales in comparison to now. I… with the admiral, by your side, I will do my best.

First of the Yamato-class battleships,
Yamato.  As the trump card for the
Decisive Battle, I was made in utmost
secrecy at the Kure Naval Yard. With the
most up-to-date and sophisticated
technology concentrated in my body,
along with the 2nd ship, Musashi, I'll do my
best as the centre of the combined fleet!

131.47: 1700, Admiral, it's almost time for the sunset.

132.1: Akigumo, reporting for duty!\nLook after me Admiral!
132.10: Mmm, yeah, equipment is important, you know.
132.11: Even Akigumo needs some repairs, yeah? I'll draw an illustration in the bath~

132.14: You wanna order one of my illustrations?
132.15: All of you who are waiting, welcome!
132.16: Battleship class... I wanna beat them up~
132.17: Makigumo, look, look! Attacking is like th~is, yeah?
132.18: The night's so dark that I can't draw very well, you know~ Let's fire up the searchlights!
132.19: Woah! A hit like this won't penetrate me!
132.21: I won't able to draw like this~!
132.22: Hey, my resting place... will anybody sketch it out...
132.23: Lo~ok, I can do things that even battleships and heavy cruisers can't, you know. Oh, do you have a sketchbook?

Yokosuka born and raised, I'm Akigumo!
I'm in the the Kagerou-class, but my
overwhelming cruising range caught the
eye of Admiral Nagumo and so I joined the
1st CarDiv. I mean, I always thought I was
a Yuugumo-class... even our uniforms are
the same... *grumble, mutter*... ah,
whatever. After that, I was assigned to
guard the 5th CarDiv. I didn't get to finish
drawing Shoukaku and Zuikaku, though...
132.28: Admiral, are you beat? Well then, Akigumo will draw a picture of you♪
132.29: Waaaa! That's it! It's almost the submission deadline, isn't it! I can't just sit around!
132.3: What what? Sexual harrasment? Is that okay?
132.30: It's 0 o'clock. Are you okay? You ain't spacing out?
132.31: 1 at night, looks like you're still going, yeah?
132.32: It's 2 o'clock, I'm a night owl too, so it's fine~ I'll stay with you while I write out a manuscript!
132.33: It's 3 o'clock, but... are you alright? Will you be okay at your job tomorrow?
132.34: It's 4 A.M. At resting times you rest! At drawing times you draw! That's what the great circles do, yeah?
132.35: 5 A.M... And that's why I sleep from morning to mid~day...Zzz

132.37: 7o'clock... As I feared, it's bright so I can't sleep... What ever will I do...
132.38: 8 o'clock. I'll be able to do a manuscript 'cause I ate breakfast... Admiral, bread or rice in the morning, what kinda guy are you?
132.39: 9 o'clock, huh... a~nyway, flipping around the front cover and submit first and then off for training!

132.40: It's now 10 o'clock~ Are you making progress on your work, Admiral?
132.41: 11. With that said, Admiral, what kind of girl do you like the most?
132.42: Lunch~! When this time comes around, it's UkiUkiWatching time!... Ah, d-don't mind me...
132.43: 1 P.M... 'Lunch time' somehow sounds fun, yeah?... What'cha eating?
132.44: 2 P.M... Well, let's do the afternoon sortie!
132.45: 3 P.M! Admiral Ranks, check 'em! It'd be great if it's gone up, yes?
132.46: 4 P.M. Almost time for the sun to go down... If it gets dark, you can't really draw, you know?
132.47: 5 P.M. Hah-... Even though I'm, always fighting, I somehow really want to draw a carrier sinking... Why?

132.5: A new shipdaughter~ Admiral likes them too, yeah?
132.50: 8 P.M... For this evening's performance, of course the searchlight will be lit!
132.51: 9 P.M. Makigumo's 'Sleep, Sleep!' is so annoying~. Why does she do it?
132.52: 10 P.M. I'm tired, so I just be borrowing a futon~ Getting in with me is for.bid.den!
132.53: 11 P.M. Just a moment's sleep! Zzzz~... This is just practice, one more time.... Admiral, you too.. go sleep!
132.6547: Fall has come around, huuuh? Oh well. The time between summer and winter is short, so you'd better be ready! But I guess fall is an easy time to let your guard doooown♪ I'll have a potato.
132.7: The fleet has come back. Good work!
132.8: A report has arrived for the admiral. Hmm, gonna read it?

I am the class-3 of Army's special

163.1: Nice to meet you... Maruyu, reporting for\nduty. Huh? You haven't heard about it?\n...Oh no...!

163.11: I’ll go take a bath... H-huh? My body’s floating, why is that!?

163.13: Maruyu will be going along too.
163.14: Maruyu can surely be of service!
163.15: Here goooes! Blub blub blub... (Diving sound)
163.19: I see you managed to find me…!
163.2: Maruyu will be carrying your luggage. Yep, we’ll be doing a mole run.

163.23: Maruyu can be amazing too, you know! ...Wait, did someone just call me a mole?
163.24: S..Sir. To care for Maruyu this much... Maruyu is touched! I'll keep on doing my best!

Maruyu isn't from the Navy shipyards, so
I don't have any friends from home. I'm a
little different from everyone else... I mean,
the first thing Kiso-san said to me was
"What are you? Can you actually go
underwater?"... I'm starting to wonder if
Maruyu can survive out here...

163.27: Now I can go back underwater!

163.29: Siiir… I get the feeling people are just looking at me from a distance… Why is that?
163.3: I-I shouldn't be afraid...of the Fleet Girls...you say?
163.30: 0000 hours. Sir, it’s now time to rest.
163.31: 0100 hours. If you’re staying up sir, so will I.
163.32: 0200 hours. Sir, I'll make sure I'll dive better tomorrow!
163.33: 0300 hours. How am I doing with everyone else? I… It's fine! Of course it's fine!
163.34: 0400 hours. You worry too much, sir.
163.35: 0500 hours. It’s almost morning. I’ll go wake everyone up.
163.36: 0600 hours. All the ships were already awake… Ha ha ha…
163.37: 0700 hours. Okay, Maruyu will off to the cafeteria.
163.38: 0800 hours. *Sigh* My eyes are red? That’s… that's just because I didn’t sleep properly last night... I think?
163.39: 0900 hours. Okay, sir! Let’s switch the mood, and march on forward!
163.4: No! Don’t look at me like that, please!
163.40: 1000 hours. I told you, I’m not sad!
163.41: 1100 hours. It’s almost time for a fun lunch!
163.42: 1200 hours. Maruyu’s going to go underwater for a bit. I’ll see you after lunch!
163.43: 1300 hours. Hmm, today’s swim went pretty well!
163.44: 1400 hours. Having a late lunch. Oh these? These are combat rations!
163.45: 1500 hours. Huh. I guess you have a lot of friends, sir.
163.46: 1600 hours. But Maruyu has you, so that’s okay.
163.47: 1700. It’s sunset. And Maruyu’s all alone…

163.49: 1900. Oh, I don’t know how to make curry… What I am going to do…
163.5: It’s a new ship daughter. I wonder if we could be friends?

163.51: 2100. Here is your curry, sir! Kiso-san taught me how!
163.52: 2200. That was good, wasn’t it sir!
163.53: 2300. Sir, friends are nice, aren’t they!

167.1: 12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze.\nDon't worry, I will protect you.
167.10: I appreciate it... with this, I can keep fighting.
167.11: I'm going to go get rid of some of this dust.
167.12: I'll stay behind in order to fight another day. It's fine, I'll be back right away.
167.14: I'm moving out. Do not concern yourself with my safety.
167.15: Enemy fleet sighted. All ships, prepare to attack.
167.16: Fire, fire, fill them up with holes.
167.17: My combat experience isn't just for show! Don't forget it!
167.18: We'll finish off the rest of the enemies. Follow my lead.
167.19: Tch... There's so much more left in me, don't underestimate me.

167.24: Commander, what? This important discussion. Is it about the 17th Destroyer Division's formation? What, it's not? Then is it something about that Hamakaze? It has nothing to do with Hamakaze... I see. Nn... That ring... to me... w-what... eh! U-um...
167.25:
12th Kagerou-class destroyer, Isokaze. If
it's about combat experience, I won't fall
behind that Yukikaze. I've fought again and
again, participated in decisive battles, and
fought to the bitter end. Yamato, Musashi,
Kongou, Taihou... their last moments have
been etched into my eyes.
This time... I will protect them.
167.27: Resupplies are important. Battles cannot be fought without them.
167.28: Admiral, have you been eating well? If you don't eat and an emergency occurs, you may not survive it. Even surviving is a splendid battle in itself. So, let's go to Mamiya to eat.
167.29: Commander...The 17th Destroyer Division, can sortie at any time... Hamakaze and I are ready... right Hamakaze?
167.3: Commander... you should stop while I'm still laughing.
167.30: The date has changed. I, Isokaze, will be reporting the time for today. What? Are you dissatisfied with it?
167.32: 0200. It's night. What? Is there any dissatisfaction?
167.33: 0300. Gah... Commander, you're making such a difficult expression. Do you have something you want to say?
167.34: 0400. It is almost morning. I think I understand what is it that the commander's so dissatisfied about, but...
167.35: 0500. But, even if I, Isokaze, is entrusted with matters outside combat. I will give it my best shot.
167.36: 0600. It is morning. Well then, it's time to make breakfast. What's with that look?
167.37: 0700. It's all right, Hamakaze told me how to do it. Here, it's done. How is it?
167.38: 0800. Commander, what's wrong? You have a stomachache? That's no good, it'll hinder your commanding abilities.
167.39: 0900. Commander, did your stomachache go away? Aren't you lacking daily training?
167.4: So be it... I will be your opponent. I will show no mercy, even should the commander stand before me.
167.40: 1000. Good, it is time for practice. The 17th Destroyer Division is ready to set sail anytime.
167.41: 1100. Leave the lunch to me as well. Tanikaze taught... Ah, why are you running away. Commander!
167.42: 1200. It's noon. Here are combat rations from Tanikaze. To have rice balls on the sea is something exceptional.
167.43: 1300. The rice balls were delicious, right? Even though Tanikaze might not like look like it, she's really adept at taking care of others.
167.44: 1400. Good, it is time for a real sortie. Let's dispatch our main fleet.
167.45: 1500. Afternoon snacks? No, no, I don't want it. I'll grow an excess bulge if I do.
167.46: 1600. Commander, let's strike the tough enemy fleet. Of course, we'll pick the line ahead formation. What, diamond formation you say? You don't understand. You don't understand!
167.47: 1700. Commander, the day is going to end soon. How time flies. Even in a single day.
167.48: 1800. Commander, the dinn— Why are you running away? It's all right, Urakaze will be helping me.
167.49: 1900. I-it took quite sometime but dinner is ready. Commander, how is it?
167.5: A new ship has been completed. That's great.
167.50: 2000. That savory egg custard, too, is from Urakaze. Ah, that grilled fish is from me, Isokaze. Is it good?
167.51: 2100. Thank goodness for Urakaze... Cooking is hard.
167.52: 2200. So it's time. Good, it's time for night battle practice. 17th Destroyer Squadron, everyone gather all around!
167.53: 2300. Commander, thank you for your work today. I look forward to another fine day tomorrow.

167.9: You're right... upgrades are necessary, thanks.
167.NotFall 6547: Commander, I'm sorry. Forget this happened.
167.Rainy 6547: Rain, huh. After all, it's the rainy season. The rain isn't so bad. I wonder... if I can settle down a bit. It really isn't a bad time of year.

17.29: Commander, are you listening? Commander? Oh, come on, Commander! What's the big idea, ignoring me?!
17.4: I'll get angry if you touch me too much, you know?
17.6: Looks like a new friend has just finished repairs.
17.8: A telegram for the commander has arrived.
17.9: Thanks! Expect great things from me!
17.Anniversary 6547: Isn't today an important day? Commander, everyone, congrats!
17.EarlySummer 6547: Shiranui~! You, should buy a new swimsuit this year, too. Eh? Ahh, sheesh! I'll choose one for you!
17.Summer 6547: Hey! We're going to sea with the 18th Division's members. Are you all wearing your swimsuits under your clothes? Shiranui, this goes for you, too!

170.1: Destroyer, Hamakaze.\nHenceforth I shall be attached to your fleet.
170.12: Let's proceed with repairs before it's too late.
170.14: Yukikaze, I'm heading out... Hamakaze, setting sail!
170.1471: Admiral, this Fall Festival is... *nom nom* *nom nom* ...so delicious, isn't it? I'm really enjoying it.
170.18: Having only anti-air battles is boring, you know?
170.19: Kuh! I can still protect them!
170.2: The breeze is pleasant again today, isn't it?
170.21: This pain is nothing... Kongou and Shinano went through much worse! I will make it to Bounomisaki... I won't lose...!
170.22: Once again... at Yamato's side... I'm going... to...
170.23: I'm not an amateur who would get worked up over victory. We can't let our guard down yet. Next up is maintenance, yes?
170.24: Admiral. If it's about matchmaking, don't you think there are plenty of other girls you can ask who are more into that? ...Eh? Me? N-No! I... this sort of thing... b-but, I'll face it head-on, study it, and put all of my effort into it... okay...?
170.25:
I am Hamakaze. I participated in many
fierce battles. At Leyte, I was in Kongou's
ring formation. Futhermore, I seared them
into my memory Musashi, Kongou and
Shinano's last moments. At the fated
Bounomisaki, I, Yukikaze and many others
struggled to protect Yamato.
170.3: Shinano... this time I'll keep you safe.
170.4: Nn...! What is it, Admiral?! What... just what are you doing with my armaments?
170.5: The construction seems to be completed.
170.6: It seems a ship's repairs have been completed.
170.6547: Admiral, you said you wanted to go to the base's Fall Festival with me? Ah, okay. In a yukata? All right, please give me a moment.
170.7: The mission has ended. The fleet has returned.
170.Rainy 6547: Hydrangea flowers? I like them, too. I think blue flowers are lovely. They calm me down.

171.1: Guten Tag. I am Bismarck, the nameship\nof the Bismarck-class battleships.\nYou should remember it well.
171.12: Apologies, I shall take a short respite. Please call on me later.
171.13: Battleship Bismarck, setting sail! Sally forth!
171.14: I shall show you how Bismarck fights!
171.15: A fleet battle... I'm itching for a fight!
171.18: I won't let you escape... Don't underestimate me!
171.2: Good. It is I, Bismarck's turn.
171.21: They got me...! The rudder! Is the rudder alright!?... Well then, I can continue on...from here.
171.22: Once again, I shall return to Brest... I exchanged enough shells... I'm...satisfied...
171.23: I am number one? What are you saying, of course that's the case. Is that not good? You can praise me more.
171.24: Admiral, what is it? Such an earnest expression... This is for me? ...I-I see... Y-you can give it to me. I won't give this back, you know? Definitely...
171.25:
It is I, the pride of Deutschland, the
nameship of the Bismarck super
dreadnoughts. Germanic designs are just
beautiful and dignified, no? It's alright,
you can praise me more. I shall be operating
far and wide throughout this ocean. You can
expect much from me!
171.27: My thanks. I can continue to fight with this.
171.28: Admiral, no matter what it is, it's bad to work too hard, okay? A change of pace is also a good thing, you know?
171.29: Geez~! To neglect one such as myself, aren't you quite something! It's fine for me to come along on a sortie or practice, you know!?
171.3: You're being quite familiar. Why is that?
171.30: 12 o'clock midnight. I'm a little tired.
171.31: 1 A.M. Admiral, is it not about time for bed?
171.32: 2 A.M. *ya~wn*... Of course, I'm tired also...
171.33: 3 A.M. You will rise properly tomorrow, yes? Could you please be punctual in the morning?
171.34: 4 A.M. I shall take a short nap. All-nighters are bad for the skin.
171.35: It's 5 A.M. Alrighty, get up! Good morning!
171.36: 6 A.M. Well now, Admiral, let's go and get all the morning affairs in order!
171.37: 7 A.M. Admiral, it is time for breakfast. What have you prepared for me?
171.38: 8 A.M. This Admiral-made breakfast is pretty good. Japanese-style isn't bad.
171.39: 9 A.M. Well now, let us up and go and start today's commerce raiding! ...Eh, I'm mistaken?
171.4: Admiral, it seems that your fleet is lacking in discipline. I shall instruct you from the basics.
171.40: 10 A.M. Kongou? Nagato? No, I don't know them. Who are they? Are they strong?
171.41: It's 11 A.M... Yamato-class? That's got a strong feeling to it. I'd like to meet them.
171.42: I am informing you that is it now 12 midday. Well now, what would be good for lunch?
171.43: 1 P.M. Oh, those destroyers of a familiar ship class are here. I know those kids.
171.44: 2 P.M. I wonder if Scharnhorst has also come here. I still would like to meet her.
171.45: It's 3 P.M. I'd like to eat a little something sweet. Hey Admiral, did you hear me?
171.46: 4 P.M. Almost evening, no? Shall we leave it at this?
171.47: 5 P.M. Phew~, today was hard work as well. Well now, shall we stop at this checkpoint for today?
171.48: 6 P.M. Almost time for dinner. Admiral, what kind of menu do you have for me?
171.49: It is 7 P.M. The admiral's sauerkraut has an odd flavor... Oh, this is 'tsukemono', you say?
171.5: It appears that a new ship has been commissioned.
171.50: 8 P.M. It's really night now... It's bad for my skin, so could we not go on a night battle?
171.51: 9 P.M. H~mm, Japanese battleships have such tall bridges. Those sisters sure are something.
171.52: It's 10 P.M. I shall take a rest soon.
171.53: 11 P.M. Admiral, are you still going? Good night.
171.7: Operation complete, the fleet has returned to port.
171.8: What is it? Has the situation changed for the better?

174.1: Guten Morgen. I'm Leberecht Maass.\nLebe is fine, yep.
174.11: Ah, they got me. I've gotta get fixed.
174.14: Not commerce raiding, but a fleet battle?... I- I can do it!
174.15: Fleet battle, huh... Okay, here I go!
174.18: Night battle huh, I'll give it a shot
174.21: The engine room is alright, I can still sail forth.
174.22: I'm sinking, once again, huh. But, this time... it was in a real battle...
174.23: I did the best? Oh... that's great, yep.
174.24: Admiral, why the serious face? Eh? What's this box... O-oh. Thank you.
174.25:
The German-born destroyer, the first
genuine large-type. This shifted high
temperature, high pressure engine, it could
only have been designed in the country of
technical skills! I'm not so great at
open-sea warfare though... I'll do my best!
174.28: Admiral, you're always working so hard, aren't you. But, you shouldn't push yourself so much. I'll work with you.
174.29: Ah, It's not that I'm bored, I'm just fine, yep.
174.3: Nn, what is it? My boiler needs servicing...
174.30: Midnight. It's a new day, yeah?
174.32: 2 o'clock. I wonder if Max is still going?
174.33: 3 o'clock. Ngh... Admiral, aren't you tired? Wow, that's impressive.
174.35: 5 o'clock. It's morning, some new missions have come.
174.36: Good morning. 6 o'clock. Admiral, good day to you.
174.37: 7 o'clock. Breakfast time, yeah? I'll go and get it started.
174.38: 8 o'clock. Admiral, how's the Nürnberger Rostbratwurst? Was it tasty?
174.39: 9 o'clock. Almost time for serious action, yeah?
174.4: Admiral, what is it? Is this one of this country's greetings? It's going to be difficult until I'm used to it.
174.40: 10 o'clock. About time to sortie. But, I've gotta be careful of mines.
174.41: 11 o'clock. I won't confuse fishing boats and enemy vessels, yep. Naturally.
174.42: 12 o'clock. Lunch time. What would be good for lunch, Admiral?
174.43: It's 13 o'clock. I wonder if Max is okay, I'm a bit worried.
174.44: It's 14 o'clock. Practice is important, even in the North Sea, yep.
174.45: 15 o'clock. Talking about seaworthiness...nah, I'm just wondering...
174.46: 16 o'clock. It's okay, I can do it.
174.47: 17 o'clock. It's getting a little dark, yep.
174.48: 18 o'clock. What shall we do for dinner?
174.49: The Sauerkraut and Eisbein, how is it? Admiral, is it tasty? Ah, 19 o'clock.
174.5: Admiral, looks like a new comrade is here.
174.51: 21 o'clock. About time for night battles, yeah? I'm not so great at those.
174.52: 22 o'clock. It's amazing, everybody here just loves night battles, I'm surprised.
174.53: 23 o'clock. Admiral, thanks for everything today. Let's do our best tomorrow too!
174.6: Admiral, a comrade's repairs have been completed.
174.8: Looking at the report? Analysis is important.

175.1: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz.\nBut, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
175.12: Entering for a few large-scale repairs. Bis bald.
175.14: We'll show them our true power. Casting off!
175.15: A fleet battle, huh...? ...Off I go!
175.16: We have the enemy. Commencing the attack.
175.21: Did I get... w-what? A mine? It wasn't...?
175.22: I'm sinking in an unfamiliar sea... ...Once again I can sleep... peacefully... ...
175.23: Oh? I'm number one? Hmm... I see. So I am. Hmm...
175.24: So what is this important business? Eh...? This is for me? Y... you... hmm... I-I see... So that's how it is... hmm... danke schön...
175.25:
Zerstörer 1934 program, third ship. I was
designed with good survivability, but...
These new turbines have a small issue with
maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
175.28: You... haven't you already done more than enough? Let's slow down a bit. It'll be fine.
175.29: Umm... is there nothing for me to do? I see... Specifically, are there no operations? Hmm...
175.3: What? Don't touch me so much.
175.4: You... does your... conduct have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm...? I see.
175.5: A new ship has been completed.

176.1: Good morning! I'm the heavy cruiser\nPrinz Eugen. Nice to meet you!
176.11: *sigh* I got hit. I'll be fixed shortly
176.13: Heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen, setting off!
176.14: Bismarck onee-sama, let's head out together!
176.17: Main battery... aim carefully...! Commence shelling!
176.19: Wha...?! I got hit! But still, I can...!
176.2: Woah! You surprised me! ...A-Aye! Setting off!
176.20: Uu... I need to snap out of it...
176.21: At this rate, Bismarck onee-sama is going to laugh at me...!
176.22: I'll... be the... first to go this time... Sakawa... Nagato... see... you...
176.23: Wha...? I'm a lucky girl? I'm nothing of the sort! I'm bad at stuff like the shallows, after all...!
176.24: Admiral, you said you needed something? Wha- t-this is for me? U-Umm, Bismarck onee-sama is... a-ah... u-um... da... danke! I'll treasure it!!
176.25:
Oh! You surprised me! I, German-born
heavy cruiser, Prinz Eugen! Admiral Hipper
class, third ship. With big sister Bismarck,
I took part in Operation Rheinübung.
Lucky fleet...really? I will keep fighting
in this sea too!
176.28: Woah...! Admiral, if you're tired, you need to take a little break. Definitely! Got it?
176.29: Bismarck onee-sama... I wonder if she's okay...? I'm a little worried... maybe I should go see how she's doing?
176.4: Admiral! Will we be doing the Rhine Exercise? ...Ah, huh? So we won't... Anyway, I'll still work hard! Leave it to me!
176.5: It looks like a new ship has been commissioned. I can't wait to meet her!
176.8: Fleet intelligence, right? Wait just a moment... Oh... oh, oh.... so that's how it is?
176.Anniversary 6547: Today is a wonderful day! Good work as usual, Admiral! Ehehe.

177.2: Oh...! Roger that! Prinz Eugen, sortieing!
177.20: I won't sink from something like this...! Return fire!
177.30: Woah?! It's exactly midnight! For today, it'll be my duty to notify you of the time. Alright, I've got it! Leave it to me!
177.31: It's now 1 a.m.! Was that okay, you think? Ah, I see! Thank goodness!
177.32: It's 2 a.m. In this country, you say... ushi-mitsu-doki-tte-iu-no? Ahh, that sounds a little funny to me.
177.33: Woah, you startled me! Ah, my hairstyle... you mean? Ahh! It's now 3 a.m.!
177.34: *stretch*... It's 4 a~m. ...nn... As expected, I'm a bit tired... but... I'm fine.
177.35: It's now 5 o'clock! Guten morgen! And what a nice morning it is! Let's do our best!
177.36: 6 o'clock. Breakfast, huh... eh? M-Me?! G-Got it! Leave it to me! Umm... hmm, what should I make? I wonder if I should make some for Bismarck onee-sama, too? Should I?
177.37: Okay! Today's breakfast is bread, sausage, and cheese. There's also salad... and of course, have some hot coffee! It's fairly typical, but delicious, right? Ah, it's exactly 7 o'clock now.
177.38: It's now 8 o'clock. So then, Admiral, let's break down today's operations! Shall we start with exercises? Or maybe expeditions?
177.39: It's 9 a.m. Hm? Ah, it's Nagato! Heeey, Naagatooo! ...Hm? Do I remember where we met? Well, of course I do! ...Ah... that is... huh? Ehehe... where was it...?
177.40: It's 10 o'clock. A battleship? 'Course! Together with Bismarck onee-sama, we'll sink it in no time! Leave it to us!
177.41: It's now 11 a.m. It's almost lunchtime, huh? For today, let's have lunch outside, okay?
177.42: Ah, it's already noon! It's midday! For lunch, does having cheese and bread outside sound good? Since it's so nice, shall we have a beer, ☆too? Aha, maybe not...
177.43: It's now 13 o'clock. Time to start the afternoon operations. Let's do our best!
177.44: 14 o'clock. Eh? What, what? Sakawa? Ah! I know her. She's that cute light cruiser.
177.45: 15 o'clock. Ah, you mean this? Yup! This is my rigging from Operation Cerberus. What do you think? Does it suit me~?
177.46: It's now 16 o'clock. Woah! You startled me, Bismarck onee-sama! You'd like to sortie together with me? Yes, certainly.
177.47: 17 o'clock. It's evening now. It's going to start getting dark. *sigh* Such a beautiful sky... Ah, of course, Bismarck onee-sama is even more beautiful!
177.48: It's 18 o'clock. I'll start preparing dinner. For today, does kaltes essen sound good? Eh... not in the mood? You'd prefer something warm?
177.49: It's 19 o'clock. Well then, I tried to make Eisbein pot-au-feu for dinner. You don't mind if the flavoring soaks into the soup, right? And finally, if you add in rice to make it a porridge, it's delicious!
177.50: It's now 20 o'clock. Japanese heavy cruisers are pretty well-rounded, huh? Hmm, hmm... mmm, I see~... hmm, hmm...
177.51: 21 o'clock. Huh? A signature move...? Let's see... I spent a lot of time shelling hordes of advancing enemy tanks! I'm pretty good at that! Yup!
177.52: It's completely dark out— 22 o'clock. Admiral, as always, good work on today's operations!
177.53: It's 23 o'clock. Hm, it's about time I was relieved so I can rest... Gute nacht... Huh? I can't...?

296.1: I'm the girl who took a diet and became an\naircraft carrier, Chitose. I even got faster.\nMaybe I should write a book about it.
296.10: No way, I might actually be cool.
296.12: Man, that's gonna leave a mark... Chiyoda will worry, so let's keep it a secret, yeah?
296.17: I hope this isn't like the Philippine Sea...
296.2: Admiral, what do you want to drink?
296.20: I won't let you hit my flight deck!
296.21: Ah man, my precious flight deck...
296.22: Chiyoda... I leave the rest... to you...
296.23: Chiyoda's gonna yell "Don't get too cocky" at me, so let's keep quiet about this.
296.24: Thank you for always looking out for the reborn Chitose, Admiral.
296.25:
Renovated from a seaplane carrier to a
carrier, I'm Chitose. Slimming down my
body by dieting. My legs even became
faster. This will let me play a part in the
Task Force! I'll do my best for you!
296.28: The admiral is always doing his utmost best. It's okay. I understand.
296.29: There is no fleet action scheduled for a while. Before the next operation, I'm going to deal with many of trivial things that may bother you in the future. Admiral, drink sake if you like, and please make yourself at home.
296.3: You want a refill, right? It's my pleasure.
296.4: Admiral, I don't recall saying it was okay to touch.
296.5: A new ship has been completed.
296.6: Repairs are over, the cans are over there.
296.7: The fleet has returned to the home port.
296.9: I wonder if Chiyoda has gotten stronger.

297.1: The girl that became an aircraft carrier,\nChiyoda. Of course, I'll be assigned to\nChitose-onee's fleet, yes?
297.10: Leyte will be okay this time!
297.11: Carrier maintenance is vital, you know.
297.12: Ow-w-w~ Keep this a secret... from Chitose-nee~
297.14: Aircraft carrier Chiyoda, launching! Attack wings are all ready, sortieing!
297.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Strike wing, commencing assault!
297.16: Right, bomber wing, attack wing, It's your turn!
297.17: I really want to fly with Chitose-nee's fleet...
297.18: It's about time for the coup-de-grace!
297.20: The flight deck's on fire!? Put it out!
297.21: Oooh... Well, I'm a light carrier... I can't be too reckless.
297.23: Yay! I can really do it with as an aircraft carrier, can't I? Chitose-nee, did you see me?
297.24: Admiral.... I'm happy that you have feeling for me, but still, I'm worried about Chitose-onee...
297.25:
Heavily remodeled from a seaplane tender,
I'm the job-changed aircraft carrier
Chiyoda. I'm quite the carrier, no?
I'll fight the enemy air force together
with Chitose-onee!
297.27: Fuu~ With this, maybe I'll make it somehow?
297.28: Admiral! Did you see Chitose-onee? Is that so? Then, erm...! Yo... you seem a little tired so I'll lend you my lap to rest on!
297.29: Hey, Admiral~! Have you seen Chitose-onee? Oh, is that so! ...Jeez, I'm kinda bored!
297.3: Eh? Did Chitose-onee do something again?
297.4: Chitose-onee, do that when we're alone in the room... Oh. It's you, Admiral?
297.5: A new ship has been added to our fleet.
297.7: Operation's complete, the fleet has returned.
297.9: Thank you! With this, I can match the regular carriers, no?

30.1: I'm Kikuzuki, let's move out together.
30.10: I won't say thanks... What will I use this power for...
30.11: Is it alright if I don't go to the front lines?
30.12: Uu, it's actually hurts... I don't want to sink
30.14: Fleet, let's do our best on sortie!
30.17: Seems like luck isn't on your side!
30.18: Too bad that this place is going to be your graveyard!
30.21: Kuh, I, Kikuzuki, am not going to sink from this!
30.22: Let's meet at the sakura tree on that hill
30.23: This is, something not to be proud of...
30.24: If this war is over… can't I stay with you, Commander…? It can't be happening, can it…?
30.25:
I'm Kikuzuki, 9th of the Mutsuki-class
Destroyers. In the very early part of
the war, I participated in lots of capture
operations. And in the latter part, I engaged
in fleet-guard. It may not look so, but
fleet-guard is an important mission for
certain.
30.29: ...That's right, I'm used to being left behind. Please don't mind me, it'll be lonely otherwise...
30.4: Uuu, W-what do you want, seriously?
30.5: Another ship have to throw herself into the battlefield again huh...
30.6547: Ahh... What is it? Since I have so much free time, and we're already near the sea, I may as well go and cast my fishing rod... I guess I will.
30.Anniversary 6547: Commander, it seems today is a special day.... It'd be good if we could celebrate it together....
30.EarlySummer 6547: It's hot... It's almost summer. Once again, summer is coming...
30.Summer 6547: Ah, a watermelon. Sounds good. When it comes to splitting watermelon... I, Kikuzuki, will never lose.

300.1: I'm Hatsukaze, nice to meet you. Admiral,\nhow many of me did you have before me,\nI wonder?
300.12: I'm going to the bath. No peeking!
300.14: Off I go! I'll leave behind these annoyances!
300.15: I'll say it straight...Myoukou-oneesan is scarier to me.
300.17: Why are you coming over here!
300.2: Ah... Admiral, thanks for the hard work.
300.21: No, D-direct hit on the bow? I've already been hit there by Myoukou-oneesan once...it's been weakened...Aah...I'm scared...
300.22: I wanted Admiral to be so much more stronger so... I kept saying harsh things to him... sorry...
300.23: This battle that was led by Hatsukaze to victory, don't forget it now.
300.24: Why're you calling me over here? I'm busy with maintenance and replenishment… eh? What? Such a large bouquet… for me? No way... I'm so happy… I'm...wha..what are you making me say, you stupid Admiral!? I-I'll just keep it!
300.25:
Kagerou-class destroyer, Hatsukaze.
Myoukou-neesan and I crashed into each
other off Bougainville, and my bow got
torn off... Crippled and unable to move,
I was the target of concentrated fire and
then... I'm scared....I'm so scared,
Myoukou-neesan...
300.28: Admiral, just where are you looking? Hatsukaze's right here.
300.29: Ah, geez, I'm so bored~! Admiral, do something~
300.3: Staaaare~ I'm just looking. Is that bad?
300.4: Hey! Just what are you touching! I'm going to hit you and fight you! Do you want me to tell Myoukou-neesan?!
300.7: The fleet returned home from battle.
300.8: This, is a letter for the commander? hmm?

301.1: Akigumo, reporting for duty!\nLook after me Admiral!
301.10: Mmm, yeah, equipment is important, you know.
301.11: Even Akigumo needs some repairs, yeah? I'll draw an illustration in the bath~
301.12: Going for a long bath~. Geez, those guys~ After I'm fixed, I'll return it twice over!
301.14: You wanna order one of my illustrations?
301.15: All of you who are waiting, welcome!
301.16: Battleship class... I wanna beat them up~
301.17: Makigumo, look, look! Attacking is like th~is, yeah?
301.18: The night's so dark that I can't draw very well, you know~ Let's fire up the searchlights!
301.19: Woah! A hit like this won't penetrate me!
301.21: I won't able to draw like this~!
301.22: Hey, my resting place... will anybody sketch it out...
301.23: Lo~ok, I can do things that even battleships and heavy cruisers can't, you know. Oh, do you have a sketchbook?
301.24: At last the admiral has been caught by my charm~? Ju~st kidding! But I wonder what kind of picture the future of me and the admiral would be… Should I seriously try drawing a thin book? Wouldn't it be great?
301.25:
Yokosuka born and raised, I'm Akigumo!
I'm in the the Kagerou-class, but my
overwhelming cruising range caught the
eye of Admiral Nagumo and so I joined the
1st CarDiv. I mean, I always thought I was
a Yuugumo-class... even our uniforms are
the same... *grumble, mutter*... ah,
whatever. After that, I was assigned to
guard the 5th CarDiv. I didn't get to finish
drawing Shoukaku and Zuikaku, though...
301.28: Admiral, are you beat? Well then, Akigumo will draw a picture of you♪
301.29: Waaaa! That's it! It's almost the submission deadline, isn't it! I can't just sit around!
301.3: What what? Sexual harrasment? Is that okay?
301.30: It's 0 o'clock. Are you okay? You ain't spacing out?
301.31: 1 at night, looks like you're still going, yeah?
301.32: It's 2 o'clock, I'm a night owl too, so it's fine~ I'll stay with you while I write out a manuscript!
301.33: It's 3 o'clock, but... are you alright? Will you be okay at your job tomorrow?
301.34: It's 4 A.M. At resting times you rest! At drawing times you draw! That's what the great circles do, yeah?
301.35: 5 A.M... And that's why I sleep from morning to mid~day...Zzz
301.36: It's finally 6 in the Morning, huh.... Admiral~ I'm gonna borrow a futon~ G'night~
301.37: 7o'clock... As I feared, it's bright so I can't sleep... What ever will I do...
301.38: 8 o'clock. I'll be able to do a manuscript 'cause I ate breakfast... Admiral, bread or rice in the morning, what kinda guy are you?
301.39: 9 o'clock, huh... a~nyway, flipping around the front cover and submit first and then off for training!
301.4: Hmmh~mm. If you want to play with me that much, then why don't I sketch you? If you look at it this way, you can see the artistic sensibilities! Hmmh~mm♪
301.40: It's now 10 o'clock~ Are you making progress on your work, Admiral?
301.41: 11. With that said, Admiral, what kind of girl do you like the most?
301.42: Lunch~! When this time comes around, it's UkiUkiWatching time!... Ah, d-don't mind me...
301.43: 1 P.M... 'Lunch time' somehow sounds fun, yeah?... What'cha eating?
301.44: 2 P.M... Well, let's do the afternoon sortie!
301.45: 3 P.M! Admiral Ranks, check 'em! It'd be great if it's gone up, yes?
301.46: 4 P.M. Almost time for the sun to go down... If it gets dark, you can't really draw, you know?
301.47: 5 P.M. Hah-... Even though I'm, always fighting, I somehow really want to draw a carrier sinking... Why?
301.48: 6 P.M... I'm hungry~ I wanna eat canned beef, yeah, canned beef... Admiral, open up a can, will ya?
301.49: 7 P.M. Yeah, canned beef with silver chalis is great!
301.5: A new shipdaughter~ Admiral likes them too, yeah?
301.50: 8 P.M... For this evening's performance, of course the searchlight will be lit!
301.51: 9 P.M. Makigumo's 'Sleep, Sleep!' is so annoying~. Why does she do it?
301.52: 10 P.M. I'm tired, so I just be borrowing a futon~ Getting in with me is for.bid.den!
301.53: 11 P.M. Just a moment's sleep! Zzzz~... This is just practice, one more time.... Admiral, you too.. go sleep!
301.7: The fleet has come back. Good work!
301.8: A report has arrived for the admiral. Hmm, gonna read it?

302.1: First ship of the Yuugumo-class, Yuugumo,\nhas arrived. Admiral, it's okay to spoil me\na bit.
302.10: Yuugumo is being remodeled. No peeping.
302.12: Sorry, I might have to be in the bath for a while. I've been a bit exhausted lately.
302.13: Destroyer Yuugumo, going with full force!
302.17: I say this gonna be quite interesting.
302.18: Mi~ss Makigumo, If you are talking about a night battle, this is how you do it!
302.19: Ah... Armour, I don't really have any, yes?
302.20: Kya! This level... I can still go on!
302.21: Kyaaaa! Now you've really done it.... I-I'll return this twice over!
302.22: Oh... I'm sinking too, no? Admiral... thanks for everything... up to now... See you... later...
302.23: Admiral, choosing me was a good idea, yes?
302.24: Ah, Admiral~, your hat is askance again. You're the commander of such a big fleet, please do look the part. Just how much do I have to look after you… eh? It's fine to keep on doing it? Well, that’s・just・lovely♡
302.25:
First ship of the final mass-production
destroyers. Laid down in Maizuru.
My first battle was the ignominious defeat
at Midway. It's okay, I don't mind. In the
Tokyo Express to that island, Operation
Ke, the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands
and the evacuation of Kiska,
I fought bravely, no? *sigh*
302.28: Admiral~ is it not a good time to take a quick break?
302.29: Aren't you tired Admiral? Yuugumo is quite worried you know...
302.3: Admiral, let's do our best together.
302.31: It's 1 A.M... Zzz... Oh, please excuse me.
302.32: It is now 2 A.M. You have to go to sleep, yes?
302.33: It's 3 A.M. I just can't leave the admiral by himself...
302.34: 4 A.M. A visitor at this time?
302.35: 5 A.M. I wondered who it was, Mi~ss Makigumo. I wasn't there so you came to look for me, yes?
302.36: 6 A.M. Miss Makigumo.... t-this... I was with the admiral all night... planning battle strategy...
302.37: 7 A.M. Well then Admiral, I'll be heading back with Miss Makigumo to our room.
302.38: 8 A.M.... Once again, it's Yuugumo. Explaining to Miss Makigumo and getting her to understand was difficult.
302.39: 9 A.M. Admiral, shall we check the rankings? Let us put in a fun comment!
302.4: Yes yes what is it~? Admiral, Makigumo, you're so fond of skinship, no?
302.40: 10 A.M. The first fleet's name, shall we change it?
302.41: 11 A.M. I thought it was an interesting name, but I wonder why the admins checked it? What a bother.
302.42: 12 midday. Treating Yuugumo is okay, no?
302.43: 1 P.M. hmm~ After eating, I get tired, no? Wait, Yuugumo didn't sleep yesterday!
302.44: It's 2 P.M. Are you really not tired? I have heard that a midday nap is good for mental activity, no?
302.45: 3 P.M. Admiral, the new rankings have been released, no? Let us have a look.
302.46: 4 P.M, the sun has set a bit, no?
302.47: 5 P.M. I wonder who today's best shipdaughter is? Naturally, it's Yuugumo, yes?
302.48: 6 P.M. Dinner with just the two of us, I'm looking forward to it.
302.49: 7 P.M. Tonight's dinner will be made by Yuugumo!
302.5: A new ship has been launched, no?
302.50: 8 P.M. Admiral, was it tasty? Was it?
302.51: It's 9 P.M. Ah, Miss Makigumo is watching from the gap. Sorry Admiral, I'll be heading back now.
302.52: 10 P.M. Would it not be amicable to have a bath soon?
302.53: 11 P.M. hmm? Admiral, let us retire early today.
302.7: The fleet has returned from the operation.
302.8: A report from headquarters. Please examine it.
302.9: Many thanks, I will use it well.

303.1: Yuugumo-class destroyer, I am Makigumo.\nFollowing Yuugumo-neesan's example, I'll\ndo my best!
303.12: Makigumo, you can really see her damage... I'll have to work harder!
303.13: It's Makigumo's turn, I'll do my best!
303.16: Heyaaa~ Right in the middle, I'll hit it!
303.17: More than scuttling, I want to shoot at the enemy!
303.19: Fuyaaa, a hit on the stern!
303.2: Commander-sama~. Makigumo always has perfect posture. Hey~? My clothes are too big~
303.20: Fuwaaaaan, even though I thought I could do it today~!
303.21: Hawawawawa, turning on the searchlight at a time like this! Akigumo, you idiot!
303.22: Yuugumo-neesan, I can't move anymore, please leave me. My final selfish request... the one to scuttle me, should be you...
303.24: Commander-sama, thank you very much for letting me take my time today. Makigumo too, has to graduate from Yuugumo-neesan some time. Is that okay?
303.25:
I'm Makigumo, second ship of the
Yuugumo-class Destroyers. While cleaning
up after the Hornet, 'situation permitting,
tow and capture it'... they said, but that was
pretty much impossible... and now
Akigumo's pointing and laughing at me.
Seriously, what the heck?
303.28: Commander-sama, do your be~st! Makigumo will too!
303.29: ...I'm always looking at Commander-sama from the screen.
303.31: Hawawawa, how is it 1 in the morning~!
303.32: 2 in the morning.... This is Makigumo's limit...
303.33: 3 A.M. Commander-sama, KanColle isn't going anywhere, so let's just sleep~...
303.36: S... s... Si... wa! Sorry, I wasn't sleeping~
303.39: It's 9 o'clock. Look after me today, too! *salute*
303.4: Hawawawawa, nobody but Yuugumo-neesan is allowed to touch me~!
303.40: It's now 10 o'clock~. I wonder what kind of person will be your practice buddy today?
303.41: It's 11 o'clock. What will Commander-sama's lunch be today?
303.42: 12 o'clock. On such a fine day, having lunch on deck is nice too~
303.43: 1 P.M. To just daydream with Commander-sama like this, it's somehow relaxing~...
303.44: 2 P.M. Commander-sama~ Let's do special training; special training!
303.45: 3 P.M. Ah, I forgot! I was invited to Kongou's tea party~!
303.46: 4 P.M. Ah, being with Commander-sama is nice... even if I don't go to the tea party...
303.47: It's 5 in the eve~ning. The sun has dissapeared~
303.49: 7 at night. Commander-sama, I desire dinner!
303.5: A new friend has been born!
303.50: It's 8 at night. Hey~ Hey~ Commander-sama, is it okay to take a bath?
303.51: It's 9 o'clock~. I'll head into the bath first. Oh~? Glasses, glasses~
303.52: It's 10 at night. Commander-sama, how are you doing?
303.53: 11 o'clock~. Commander-sama~, Makigumo, is all sleepy~...
303.9: Hmmhmmm! My new armament, how is it?

304.1: I'm Naganami-sama, the 4th ship of the\nYuugumo-class destroyers. And off we go.\nYeah!
304.10: This Naganami is just gonna get stronger, ya know.
304.12: I really wanna fight more, but I gotta go wash up. Sorry!
304.13: Now, let's go do a replay of Savo!
304.14: Not bad, gotta love the rag-tag fleets!
304.15: All ships, follow me! We're charging in!
304.16: Ugh, don't let your guard down in a shoot-out!
304.17: Let them cut our clothes, and we break their bones!
304.18: All right, drop the gas drums, battle stations!
304.21: Ahh! Ah, what an embarrassment... Don't you forget this! We're comin' back for you!
304.22: I guess this is it... My proud days with the Second Torpedo Squadron... I'll never... forget...
304.23: On par with Admiral Tanaka's very own command. That was awesome, Admiral. We can do this!
304.24: What is it? With that glum face and all.If you keep acting that way, it'll spread to the entire fleet, you know. Well, I'll lend this Naganami's chest to you here. Now, spit out your problems. Now, in a big voice! Eh? I-it's that!? Well, that's fine too, I guess...
304.25:
I'm Naganami, the fourth ship of the
Yuugumo-class destroyers, built and
launched during wartime under the Maru-4
project. I rampaged all over as a member
of the proud 2nd Torpedo Squadron. At
Guadalcanal, we gave an enemy ambush
a beatdown under the famous command
of Rear Admiral Tanaka Raizo.
304.27: Resupply is the basics of all.
304.28: Aa~, of course I get you, Admiral. How lovely~
304.29: Hmm, if you're not going to sortie, how about a nap? The night's long.
304.30: It's 0 o'clock. Hey, someone's here... Oh, Nenohi... What, you wanna say that it's ne-no-shoukoku?
304.31: 1 AM. Hey, is it okay if I watch some late night shows?
304.32: 2 AM, huh... You're working hard, Admiral... That's good!
304.33: 3 AM. Hey, you were dozing off just now.
304.34: It's 4 AM. Give up and go to bed already!
304.35: 5 AM. The city's getting ready right about now.
304.36: It's 6 AM... Yup, it's totally morning.
304.37: 7 AM. Let's grab some grub, and make operational plans the day ahead, huh?
304.38: 8 AM. The docks are gonna get busy this time around.
304.39: 9 AM, huh... Shall we head out with a full-on roster?
304.40: 10 AM. Having something to eat now? ...Huh. So it's called a "brunch"? That's kinda cool.
304.41: 11 AM. And here comes Nenohi again... What is it this time?
304.42: Noon. Nenohi told me that this gozen (AM) and gogo (PM) thing is coming from the term, "hour of the horse".
304.43: 1 PM. Nenohi went back with a smile... I guess she wanted to do the hourly report thing.
304.44: 2 PM. Yuugumo came by just now. Brought us something to snack on. She's always the caring one.
304.45: 3 PM. The Kongou's are having a party over there! Not sure why, but they're crazy, aren't they!
304.46: 4 PM. How was the ranking, huh?
304.47: 5 PM. Once you've seen the rankings, why don't you change the comments too? I mean, they do say to treasure every meeting since it's once in a lifetime... Or uh... that might be different.
304.48: 6 PM. I kinda feel like having fried rice.
304.49: 7 PM. Whoa! Admiral, you're amazin' at making fried rice! Thanks!
304.5: A fresh n' lively fleet girl, up and ready!
304.50: 8 PM. Someone's getting restless... Oh, it's Sendai. Looks like she's just doing her thing.
304.51: 9 PM. All right, now let's get serious!
304.52: It's 10 PM. Girl's talk? ...Well, other than the other Yuugumo-classes, I guess I get along with Shimakaze and Yukikaze.
304.53: It's 11 PM. I wish we could get the Second Torpedo Squadron together again.
304.7: A fleet's returned! Let's go greet 'em!
304.8: Here a report to ya, Admiral. So, how 'bout it?
304.9: No, no! I'm okay, I can switch equipment by myself!

305.1: Hello! I'm the latest light cruiser Agano.\n*giggle*
305.10: Kirari~n! A new Agano! How is it?
305.11: Agano's just... going to the washroom for a while.
305.12: Uuu... I got beat... Yahagi's gonna get mad again... dangit....
305.15: Finally Agano's show time, right? Hehehe, I've been waiting.
305.18: No way, I'm not gonna lose to Noshiro or Sakawa, you know?
305.21: Geez, no way... I'm all tattered, aren't I?
305.22: Again.... Agano leaves before everyone else? Well, that's okay, I worked pretty hard this time... bye bye.
305.23: Huh? At last, Agano's the best? Yeah! D-did you see, Yahagi. This is the true power of the Agano-class!
305.24: Admiral. Thank you for always taking such good care of me. Eh? I seem different from always? Well, yeah, I guess so because, you know, today's a special day! It's a special day for you and me!
305.25:
Designed and built as the next-generation
of Torpedo squad flagships, Agano-class
light cruiser, the eldest, is me, Agano!
I've got the the high-end technology!
Have a look, this refined body... This time,
I'll certainly show off my special features!
305.28: Admiral, how have you been? That's good to hear. If you're not feeling well, I'll use my Kirarin Beam! Hah...! You want me to? Alright... Agano, kirarin!
305.29: Agano-class, first ship, Agano, will be waiting for you all the time, right? Admiral?
305.3: Admiral, what is it? Something you need with me?
305.30: 12 o'clock! Is where the enemy is coming from! Just kidding. Sorry, it's the time.
305.31: 1 o'clock at night. Agano, can she sleep?
305.32: 2 o'clock in the morning, Agano's always sound asleep now~
305.33: Admiral! It's 3 A.M! Geez, you work too hard!
305.34: It's 4 in the morning, you know.... Well, the dailies refresh in an hour...
305.35: 5 A.M. For Kancolle, the new day is starting! Do your best!
305.36: 6 A.M. Admiral! Agano, she's wide awake!
305.37: 7 A.M. What should we do for the morning petit four? Hey, Admiral?
305.39: It's 9 A.M. Admiral, are today's dailies done? Ah, I see!
305.4: I-I'm not slacking off! I'm just adding an entry to the admiral's log!
305.40: 10 A.M. Where should we try to go today?
305.41: 11 A.M. Let's slow down a bit before lunch, okay? I'm already empty.
305.42: Yeah! Midday! Lunch! What are you having?
305.43: 1 P.M. I'm making fried rice! Without shrimp, of course!
305.44: It's 2 P.M! Agano, giving a report! Let's take a aftenoon nap...
305.46: It's 4 P.M. Aw crud! I think I overslept!
305.47: 5 P.M. Ah, what should I do... the promise to drink tea with Noshiro... I forgot...
305.48: 6 P.M. The promise with Noshiro? Yeah, that always happens, I tend to forget the time...
305.49: It's 7 P.M. So then, by following Noshiro, we can have dinner together, yeah?
305.5: Hm? The factory workers are waving their hands!
305.50: It's 8 P.M. Sorry! It's time for what I said before!
305.51: It's 9 P.M. Noshiro really needs me ... Huh? The opposite you say?
305.52: It's 10 P.M. Admiral, thanks for the work today. Agano is already sleepy...
305.53: It's 11 P.M. Agano is already completely tired. Admiral, good ni~ght...
305.6: Just got out of the bath? How was the water temperature?
305.8: The admiral's report, eh? Lemme see, lemme see!
305.9: Wait a bit, if Agano gets even better performance than this...

306.1: Second light cruiser of the Agano-class,\nNoshiro, has arrived. Glad to meet you!
306.10: This is... many thanks! Noshiro will not sink!
306.11: Noshiro will take a small break.

324.29: Just like this... I'm always watching. Watching... always... forever.
324.3: Heh... Yeah. This scenery hasn't changed.
