324.33: 0300. Pulling an all-nighter will harm your body, Commander. Rest for awhile.
324.34: 0400. The blue of the morning sky. I don't hate it, but it's a little cold right now.
324.35: 0500. I'm sorry, was my hand cold to the touch?
324.36: 0600. Let's wake everyone up and get ready for the day.
324.37: 0700. The morning checks have been done... Let's look for Mamiya-san... And have our breakfast.
324.38: 0800. Commander, here's the mission file for the day. Let's start by looking at it closely.
324.39: 0900. All fleets that can be deployed have been sent out on expeditions. What should we do with the remaining ships?
324.4: Commander? To care about me, you're really kind.
324.40: 1000. Ah... What is it, Shiranui-san? Did you need us for anything?
324.41: 1100. Commander, I'll be making... Maizuru-styled meat stew for lunch, alright? Fufu...
324.42: 1200. How was... the meat stew? There's enough... For seconds.
324.43: 1300. Saying it was delicious... That's... Troubling for me...
324.44: 1400. Commander, am I... Mistaken about anything? Oh, I see. It's fine then.
324.45: 1500. It's time for... Some snacks. Caramel... I don't hate it.
324.46: 1600. The caramel was delicious. Makigumo-nee-san... You ate too much.
324.47: 1700. Commander, fighting a losing battle is detestable isn't it? No more...
324.48: 1800. I'll make dinner. It's not something to be made light of... It's curry.
324.49: 1900. I added some coconuts from the southern islands into my curry. Fufu...
324.5: More battle strength is needed... again... they increased.
324.50: 2000. There's enough curry for every girl, so please help yourself to it.
324.51: 2100. Commander, how was Hayashimo's curry? Fufu...Fufufufu...
324.52: 2200. Ah, Nachi-san brought the whiskey bottle. Will you drink some?
324.53: 2300. When I'm together with the commander... I'll... Forget about all these unpleasant happening.
324.6: The repair... right... Repair is repair.
324.7: The fleet returned. Fu...Fufufu. They returned.
324.8: Commander, you'll look at the data? I see...
324.9: Stronger... will anything change if I get stronger?

325.1: Hello! Last of the Yuugumo-class, it's\nKiyoshimo! I'm a bit late, but I'll be in\nyour care!
325.10: How am I looking? Am I cool? Strong?
325.11: I wish I sortie with battleshi~ps!
325.12: I'll be in the bath for sliiiightly longer. Yup.
325.14: Operation Rei-Gou? No? It's all good! Sortieing anyway!
325.15: I won't lose to Yuugumo-neesan or my other sisters!
325.16: I wonder how Musashi-san is doing? I've got to give it my best too!
325.17: I said I'd protect you this time, didn't I?
325.18: A night deployment, huh... I ended up remembering that night.
325.19: Hyaa!? It'll be the end if that hit on target!
325.2: Hey, aren't you glad it's Kiyoshimo?
325.21: Huh? The left side? Huh? Navigation is impossible? No way... That's... Really bad isn't it...?
325.22: Am I... going to sink... again? It's fine... Everyone, go on ahead... Once you hit the enemy... come back, ok?
325.23: Hmhmm, how's that? Now you've seen what I can really do. You want to go ahead and remodel me into a battleship now?
325.24: Commander? What's wrong, you have such a serious look on your face? Eh, what's... this? This is for me? Really? Nn... thank you. I wonder... why... I'm starting to tear up.
325.25:
I'm Kiyoshimo, the 19th and last of the
Yuugumo class destroyers. I was born in
Uraga, dont'cha know. And goodness, what
a horrible situation it was that I was born
into, as well. I wasn't around for long but
I took part in several fleet actions. Leyte
was, of course, apalling to see but I even
took part in Operation Rei-gou!
How's that?
325.28: Commander? You know, if you're tired, you can take a break with me? Right, right?
325.29: Hey, Commander? What's that, what are you doing? Hey, watcha dooin? Tell me tell me tell meeeeeee?
325.3: Hmhmmmm! Uraga born and bred. Great, isn't it?
325.30: 00000! Eh? Was there an extra 0? 0000-... H-huh? Huh? Huuuh?
325.32: 0222! Wah, I messed up again. I'll get it this time! It's 0200!
325.33: 03! ...00... I'm sleepy... This mission, is tough...
325.34: 0400. I'm seriously sleepy right now! Won't someone take over already?!
325.35: 0500! Eh? If I do this right, I'll become a battleship? Guh... I guess I'll do my best.
325.37: 0700. Hey, Kiyoshimo's gonna try her best and make breakfast, ok?!
325.38: 0800. How is breakfast? Let's eat our fill and turn into battleships together!
325.39: 0900. Commander, we should go for morning training together. Let's go!
325.4: Geez, Commander! ...Keep it a secret from my older sisters? Ok?
325.40: 1000. Ugh... I ate too much for breakfast... And it feels bad after I've exercised... Uuu...
325.41: I don't feel so good... 11..0..0... S-Somehow I managed to report the time. Guh...
325.42: 1200. Commander, I'm sorry... Please go ahead with lunch by yourself... I can't do it.
325.43: 1300. What did you have for lunch? Omurice with Yamato-nee-sama? H-how nice...
325.44: 1400. Eh, Kasumi-chan? What's wrong, you're here because you're worried about me again?
325.45: 1500. I got a riceball from Kasumi-chan because I didn't have lunch! Let's have it now. Mmm, this flavor of salt from the salted plum is great.
325.46: 1600. Commander, this Kiyoshimo has mended her ways. Let's do it!
325.47: 1700. Right, I should get to cleaning the office and prepare for outfitting!
325.48: 1800. Commander? There's night battle training for the day? Of course! I'll join too!
325.49: 1900. Right! For this part, I should use the star flare, star flares... Huh? I don't have one?
325.50: 2000. Really, the members Second Torpedo Squadron were strong. How nice...
325.51: 2100. Huh, Kasumi-chan? Another riceball? Is it ok to have it?
325.52: 2200. Oh right, I was so engrossed in the night battle that I forgot about dinner. Commander, are you hungry? Shall we have dinner together?
325.53: 2300. Ehh!? You had beef steak with Musashi-san? How nice... You should've invited me along too! That's not fair!
325.8: Commander? Want to see the message? Hm?
325.9: I wonder how many more remodels will it take for me to become a battleship...? Eh? O-of course I can!

326.1: We are Hatsuharu.\nWe thank you in advance.
326.10: Did you not say that the equipment up to now was not quite up to par?
326.11: Phew... this bath is nice. As I thought, cypress-tree baths are supreme.
326.12: This arsenal has such skilled craftsman, we are unperturbed.
326.15: Thou wishest to see our dance? Very well... we shall show thee plenty!
326.18: At long last... we shall demonstrate our true purpose!
326.2: Oh, are you interested in us?
326.20: Verily, thou shalt experience our wrath!
326.21: 'Tis but a scratch! We shall not sink from just this!
326.23: This triumph, it was not solely due to our efforts. Everyone did their part.
326.24: You...!? W-w-w-w-aaa! To expose us to such shameful words! Shame on you! For shame...
326.25:
We are the 1st Hatsuharu-class destroyer,
Hatsuharu. We were attached to the
Northern Force. As the clouds of war
gathers, we did our duty in the Northern
seas at such places as Attu and Kiska.
The seas around Hokkaido are our favorite,
no? The Gulf of Manila and Ormoc...
Ah, we are weak to the heat.
326.27: We are grateful... no hardships in this.
326.28: You should... rest a little better as well. Of course, we can rest when it's important. ...It's pleasant!
326.29: Aah, well, you know, it would be all right if we did some work... it would be all right, you know?
326.3: Yes, this is how you should be treating us.
326.4: You really can't calm down, can you?... Why is that? Dost thou take such interest in us?
326.5: A new ship is complete, perchance?
326.6: Good grief.. Are the repairs finally finished?
326.7: It appears that the fleet has returned. Surely, a triumph?
326.8: That's right, information is important. Good good. There is a lot to inquire from this.
326.9: Yes. We became stronger once more.

327.1:
Asashio-class destroyer, Asagumo,
reporting in! So you're the Commander...
Huh. Hmm. Well, it's fine.
I'll do it!
327.10: Oh my, yes. That was... quite helpful. Nice equipment... I think.
327.11: I'm going to take a bath. Seriously, no peeking!
327.12: I'm getting in the bath. Geez, even though I said to properly service my turbine!
327.13: DesDiv 9, sortieing! Yamagumo, as always... together!
327.14: Destroyer Asagumo, setting sail. Leave it to me.
327.15: I found enemy ships!, begin firing! DesDiv 9, charge!
327.16: Don't mess with DesDiv 9! We can do it, keep moving forward!
327.18: Night battle, huh. Yep, let's do this!
327.20: Tch... That hurts, you know! Quit it!
327.21: I...I've been beaten...but, I can still navigate..! As if I'll sink!
327.22: ...Fufu, Yamagumo... We're together again. It's not like I'm... like I'm lonely, you know...
327.23: See, isn't it me? I won't lose to the likes of the Kagerou-class. Obviously!
327.24: What, Commander? I'm pretty busy here... Heh, what? Another joke. ...Eh, you're serious? Ah, what do I do... Y-Yamagumo is... Ehh, umm...
327.25:
Asashio-class destroyer number 5,
Asagumo. Together with my sworn friend
Yamagumo, we made it through many
battlefields. That's right, the 9th DesDiv.
Famous, right? Eh, you haven't heard of us?
You know, I don't really like jokes.
Remember that!
327.26: I'll take it off your hands!
327.27: That's right, supplies are important. Ah, I see, you knew that already, Commander.
327.28: Commander...Its good that you're working hard, but if you overdo things, it makes me worried, seriously! Yes, make sure you rest appropriately...got it?
327.29: Wh-What? There's nothing for me to do? Well, it's fine, but kinda annoying. I know, shall I massage your shoulders? Ah, I'm kidding. Just kidding, of course!
327.3: Whaat? I'm pretty busy, you know.
327.30: Commander! It's gotten pretty late... I'll keep you company for today. It just became midnight, after all!
327.31: It's 0100! The night's a bit cold...
327.32: It's 0200...? What's with that face...? I'm not particularly sleepy or anything. you know?
327.33: It's 0300...? Commander... are you feeling drowsy? You have terrible bags under your eyes... Are you not getting enough sleep? Its fine if you have a nap, I'll be on night watch from here on.
327.34: Its 0400, huh... These early morning hours are cold... I don't hate it, though... What do you think, Commander... oh you fell asleep...?
327.35: It's 0500! Commander! Get up! We have to go wake everyone up soon! Hey, are you listening?
327.36: It's become 0600! Everyone, raise up! Okay? ...Commander? Are you even awake?
327.37: It's 0700! Breakfast time... bread is fine, isn't it? Toast? Aren't you demanding...here you go.
327.38: 0800... I'll take care of the plates, pass them here. Ah, the jam on the toast was good, wasn't it? Yamagumo gave it to me!
327.39: Its 0900. Its about time for the fleet to seriously start running...please use us destroyers well, too! Commander? Are you listening?
327.4: What is it, geez. Eh, you're interested in Asagumo? Then it can't be helped, huh.
327.40: Its 1000 huh... Are the expeditions okay? Our tasks are progressing at a good rate...all thats left is...uh, Commander? What are you doing? Hey?
327.41: Its 1100. Can I have lunch with Yamagumo? I promised her. Ah, she's not a bad girl, really! I guarantee it!
327.42: Its 1200 right? Commander, this is my best friend Yamagumo. She's a little weird, but please look after her! Uhh... Yamagumo, where are you going? Hey!
327.43: 1300. Commander, sorry...it seems like she had something on her mind...I'll ask her about it later! Sorry...how strange though...
327.44: Its 1400 now. As an apology for not eating lunch with you, I bought this at the canteen. We can eat this together...or rather, I'll give it to you, okay?
327.45: Its 1500 huh...Ah! It's Kirishima-san! Welcome back! Yes, Asagumo has been doing well! Yes!
327.46: Its 1600 now. Eh, my attitude towards Kirishima-san is different? Of course, that person is amazing! After all, I saw it! Mmm, I saw it!
327.47: 1700. It's about time to prepare dinner. Ah don't worry, I'll prepare it! I said I'll do it, don't worry about it!
327.48: Its 1800 now. Okay, dinner is served! Eh, you're complaining about the barley rice? What are you talking about, this is the basis of the dish! It's also very nutritious!
327.49: 1900. Hm? But the yellowtail teriyaki was delicious? I know right? It goes will with barley and rice, doesn't it?
327.5: Commander, it seems a new child has been completed. I wonder what they'll be like?
327.50: It's become 2000. The night...the night is not my strong point. Ah, don't worry, I'm fine....now...
327.51: Its 2100 now. Oh, Yamagumo? What is it? No no, thats wrong! That's absolutely wrong! Jeez!
327.52: 2200. Yamagumo has some kind of misunderstanding...sometimes she goes into la-la land with her thoughts. She's usually pretty normal though...
327.53: Its 2300, huh...its completely nighttime now. The naval base is...not very quiet though. Yeah, I'll have to go give a warning.
327.7: Mission complete. The fleet has returned to base. It's good to see everyone's safe.
327.8: That's right, you always need to check your information. Isn't that common sense?

328.1: Good morning. Asashio Destroyer number\nsix, Yamagumo. Please treat me well!
328.10: How is it~? Does it suit Yamagumo~? Really~?
328.11: I guess a bath is nice too~
328.12: Uh, I'm sorry~ I'll take it easy with a bath~
328.14: Oh, Asagumo-nee? Do you want to go together?
328.16: Uh-huh~ I want to hit as much as possible~
328.18: Night battles~ Yamagumo might just be a li~ttle bit bad at them~
328.20: No~ Yamagumo is weak against attacks~!
328.21: I guess I need to get a bi~t more serious.
328.22: I'm sinking, huh... Asagumo-nee... don't come... okay?... See you... later...
328.23: Huh~ Yamagumo was the best~? Oh, I guess that could happen~ That's interesting~
328.24: Commander, what is it? Are you giving this box to Yamagumo? I wonder what it is? Ooh, pretty~ Thank you~
328.25:
I'm the sixth Asashio-class destroyer,
Yamagumo. I was born in Osaka and raised
in Yokosuka. Uh-huh, I'll have to watch out
for sea mines. I was active in escort and
patrol missions, then deployed to the
Marianas and also Leyte Gulf as part
of the Nishimura fleet.
328.28: Commander, you're working so hard~ How admirable~ Yamagumo thinks that you're really quite amazing~ Yes, really!
328.29: U~m~ Yamagumo kind of likes having free time~ But Asagumo-nee~ she's an impatient person~ you know~?
328.3: You can't do that~. That's delicate~. The depth charges, they're sensitive~.
328.30: Commander~ Yamagumo is today's secretary huh...sure, I'll do it!
328.31: 01...00! Am I doing it right? Is that so?
328.32: 02...00! Midnight's over~ For some reason, I feel pretty nervous around this time...
328.33: 03...00! Around this time, I start to feel strange...fuu~
328.35: 05...00! Commander, morning is near! How reassuring....right?
328.36: 06..00! It's daytime! We'll need to wake everyone up! I like the morning.
328.37: 07...00! Commander, I will leave your breakfast here. Today's breakfast includes a fresh egg...be sure to put it on top of your rice!
328.38: 08...00! Isn't egg mixed with rice tasty? It's also tasty with brown rice...Yamagumo likes it too!
328.39: 09...00! Oh right, during today's lunch, I'm going with Asagumo on a date! A date...isn't that nice? I'm looking forward to it!
328.4: U~m~, sorry. If you're too pushy, I'll seriously get angry, you know?
328.40: 10...00! Asagumo is a soft person...that's why I like her!
328.41: 11...00! Commander, how do I look? I look fine? Alright, I'm heading out!
328.42: 12...00! Is that...Fusou and Yamashiro? Uuh, for some reason, my stomach is starting to hurt...uuh, guess I'll go home...
328.43: 13...00! Commander, I am fine now! I made a U-turn and came back~ I'll return to work now~
328.44: 14...00! All members of the expedition team are accounted for! Mission progress is okay! Commander, the fleet is doing well~
328.45: 15...00! Ah, these? They are vegetables I grew from my own garden! I was taught how to do that in Rabaul~
328.46: 16...00! If you boil these vegetables, add a lot of sugar and make it into a jam, its surprisingly tasty! See?
328.47: 1700! Before you know it, its already evening....the day sure goes quickly~
328.48: 18...00! Yamagumo will be making dinner tonight! I'll be making a curry using my home grown vegetables! It's delicious!
328.49: 1900! Yamagumo's home grown vegetable curry was good right? Hm? Who did I grow these vegetables with? I did it with Asagumo!
328.50: 20..00! After this, I'm going on a date with Asagumo again, I can't wait! My tie isn't crooked right? I feel nervous~
328.51: 21...00! I'm heading off! Asagumo...! Huh...who is....that? They look....close....Huh...? Tears are...falling out of my....huh?
328.52: 22...00....Commander...Asagumo is with an unknown guy...um...eh? That's not right? Is that what it is? Oh, is that all~
328.53: 2300! What a relief...Asagumo is working huh~ Commander, Yamagumo is relieved...I felt so tense...
328.6: A girl have just came out of the bath~
328.7: The fleet has returned~. Oh, that's good~, isn't it?
328.8: Information, I see. That's really important, isn't it?

329.1: Kagerou-class Destroyer, Nowaki, reporting\nin. Well, Commander. Let us proceed.
329.10: This is good... With this, I feel like I can keep going.
329.11: Just let me... rest a bit.
329.12: I'm sorry... As soon as I've recovered, I'll return to the front.
329.15: Fourth Torpedo Squadron, attack! Follow me!
329.17: Compared to Mariana or Leyte, this is nothing!
329.18: We'll do it! All ships, attack!
329.21: They got me... I-I can still move. I won't... sink yet!
329.22: No good... I'm sinking... Chikuma-san... I'm sorry... I... hh...
329.23: That's... that's right! Maikaze, you saw it! This is the ability of the 4th DesDiv!
329.24: Commander, what is it? Maikaze is waiting so I have to go back... eh?... this is... uhm... I have to report to Naka-san... eh?... it is not needed?
329.25:
Kagerou-class destroyer number 15,
Nowaki. Born in Maizuru. I was with Maikaze
in the 4th DesDiv. At the start of the war,
I participated in the Southern Operation in
the 4th Torpedo Squadron under Naka-san,
as well as Midway, Mariana, and Leyte. I will
do my best with whatever I can.
329.27: Thank goodness... Now I can fight.
329.28: Commander, are you perhaps tired?... don't overwork yourself, please, take a rest.
329.29: Maikaze, what are you up to...? Are you well...? Ah, Commander! I'm alright! Nowaki, on standby!
329.3: Commander, is it possible that... you could stop calling me Nowacchi?
329.30: Commander, Nowaki will be serving as your secretary ship for today. I will be in your care.
329.31: 0100. Commander, it is the late night.
329.32: 0200. Commander, it is now the hour of ushimitsu.
329.33: 0300. Commander, you're not tired? How impressive!
329.34: 0400. Commander, are you even understanding the meaning of my words? Wow, very impressive!
329.35: 0500. It's morning. We should prepare to wake everyone else soon.
329.36: 0600. Morning. Nowaki shall begin preparations for breakfast.
329.37: 07...00. Ah, excuse me, I got engrossed in preparing breakfast... Today is a Japanese breakfast. Please, help yourself.
329.38: 0800. How did you like my breakfast? Ah, is that so, excellent.
329.39: 0900. Soon, our Fourth Destroyer Squadron will sortie in full force as well. Commander, your orders!
329.4: Maikaze, stop it... Commander? ...What is the meaning of this?
329.40: 1000. Maikaze, dancing around all the time like that is dangerous... Ah, Commander, I'm sorry!
329.41: 1100. Commander, it will be noon soon. What will you have? Nowaki will follow your orders.
329.42: 1200... Ah, Akagi-san. And to what do we owe the plea- Eh? Lunch? Y, yes! Help yourself!
329.43: 1300. That surprised me back then. Excuse me... No, I'm fine.
329.44: 1400. Well, let's do our best with the afternoon's missions too. Commander, what's next?
329.45: 1500. Maikaze, I'm sorry, I'm working right now... Haah, it can't be helped... Jeez.
329.46: 1600. Commander, excuse me. I'll be fine. It won't have any effect on the fleet's duties.
329.47: 1700. Soon the sun will fall, huh. Commander, the setting sun... is a bit sad, huh.
329.48: 1800. I will handle the preparations for dinner. How would steak be, every once in a while?
329.49: 1900. I tried a little harder at dinner. Commander, how is the taste?
329.50: 2000. Commander, it's best to exercise a little after dinner, exercise.
329.51: 21... Ah, Tone-san, Chikuma-san! Chikuma-san, I'm perfectly fine.
329.52: 2200. Commander, it's a quiet night. It would be nice if all nights could be like this, huh.
329.53: 2300. Commander, thank you very much for today's hard work. Nowaki will try her best tomorrow as well!
329.7: The fleet has returned. Good work.

33.1: So you're the commander, huh.\nWell, you better try your hardest!
33.10: I can fight on with this... ...W-What? I-I'm not thanking you or anything!
33.11: My clothes got a little dirty...
33.12: ...! ...I can't believe I have to go into the dock... how humiliating...!!
33.14: Ha! Finally, to the front lines!
33.17: All you fools in my path... just sink!!!
33.18: Now this is where I really shine!
33.22: I won't forgive you... I will never forgive you for this!!
33.23: Well, it's only natural. ...What? Are you dissatisfied?
33.24: I just want to tell you... well, I don't really dislike you, you know. I guess you can order me to do anything... you want... What are you...?! I-I didn't mean it like that!
33.25:
Special type destroyer, fifth ship Murakumo.
What? You don't know me? Really, that's
impossible. Don't even know a famous ship
like me, who participated in the Southern
Operations, relief of Furutaka, and many
other operations, you really are inept!
33.29: You... just how are long you planning on making me wait here?! What the hell! What are you thinking? Geez... hurry it up!
33.3: You look restless. Are you okay?
33.4: You... I'll make you eat these oxygen torpedoes!
33.5: Looks like the newest member of the fleet has arrived.

33.8: It's an urgent coded transmission. You should read what it says.
33.9: Heh. Not bad... this'll make me even more captivating.
33.Anniversary 6547: Oh, isn't today an important day!? Okay, you come here, too!
33.Rainy 6547: The rainy season, huh.... Well, it isn't so bad. It allows us to take it easy for a while. You dislike it?

330.1: Akizuki-class anti-air destroyer, first ship,\nAkizuki. I'm reporting in here.\nPlease leave it to me!
330.10: With this, I won't lose to the enemy fleet!
330.11: J-just for a bit, I'll take a break...
330.12: My anti-air fire director too, I need to firmly attach it...

330.14: 61st DesDiv, setting sail immediately. Setting off!
330.15: Now, shall we begin? Commence firing!
330.16: While this Akizuki still has strength, I won't let you!
330.17: I feel like... the barrage is light. Barrage!
330.18: Akizuki's night battle, shall I show it to you?
330.19: Kugh! I can still go on!
330.20: Defending against torpedo attack! It's alright !
330.21: Hit!? Abandon all torpedoes, prevent detonation!... not yet... I can keep going!
330.22: Shoukaku-san... Taihou-san... are you well? Ugh..., alright... the fleet is... alri... ght...
330.23: Akizuki protected the fleet. It went well, and next time will go well, too!
330.24: Commander, did you call me? Um, was my anti-air inadequate? That's not it? Then does it have to do with Shoukaku-san? Not that either? ...Howaa~, could this be... Th-Thank you very much!
330.25:
Designed for the fleet's anti-air, Type-B
first class destroyer, Akizuki-class 1st
destroyer, Akizuki. As an anti-air ship
equipped with 4x 8-barrel Long 10cm guns
and anti-aircraft fire director, along with
Hatsuzuki and the others, we formed the
61st DesDiv. I'll do my best!
330.27: Thank you for the important supply materials!
330.28: Commander, thanks as always. This Akizuki will protect the fleet, and you. Yeah, it's alright!
330.29: Long 10cm, check! Anti-aircraft fire director, check! Oxygen torpedoes, check... alright! Everything's perfect! Umm, next is...
330.3: The added anti-aircraft fire director and long 10cm guns. Akizuki's real power... with this, I'll protect the fleet!
330.30: Commander, Akizuki will report the time. The current time is 0000!
330.31: The 0100 report. Is this the right way, Commander?
330.32: 0200. The moon tonight... the moon sure is beautiful, Commander. Eh, Commander?
330.33: 0300, Commander. It's very quiet at this time. It's really quiet...
330.34: 0400. Commander, are you not tired?　Let's have some strong tea.
330.35: It is now 0500. Commander. Yes. Akizuki, prepared to wake everyone, roger!

330.4: Choujuusenchihou-chan, don't struggle! Eh, huh? Ad...miral? Ahh! Please excuse me!
330.40: It's the 1000 report. Commander, I wish to properly complete the exercises as well.
330.41: 1100. Commander, what will you have for lunch? Shall I prepare it for you?
330.42: 1200. Commander, lunch is rice balls and pickled radish. Ah, sorry that it's simple...
330.43: It is now 1300. Commander, I apologize. I'll try my best to prepare a wonderful dinner!
330.44: 1400. I wonder how Hatsuzuki is... Ah, Commander. Let's do our best in the afternoon too!

330.46: 1600. Yes, I've attached an anti-air fire director on the stern as well. It's perfect!

330.49: 1900! Piping hot barley and rice, pickled radish, also canned beef, and miso soup♪ How is it?
330.5: It seems like a new ship was born!
330.50: 2000. Yes, today, I pushed myself a bit extra. How was I?
330.51: 2100. Eh, Suzutsuki? Yes, she's a little sister I'm proud of. Ei!
330.52: 2200. Ah, Shoukaku-san, Zuikaku-san. Good work. Yes, I'm alright!
330.53: 2300. I was a bit nervous. Haa... Commander, very good work today.
330.6: It seems that the under repairing ship leaves dock.
330.7: The fleet has safely returned. Everyone, good work!
330.8: That's true. It's important to know what the fleet knows!

331.1: I'm Amagi, an Unryuu-class Carrier.\nThanks for your recruitment, Admiral.\nAmagi will concentrate!
331.10: Amagi is thankful for the new aircraft. Thank you very much.
331.11: It's not a serious wound but...thanks, Admiral.
331.12: I'm sorry. I'm going to take a lot of time in the bath. I'm truly sorry.
331.13: Amagi, flagship of the carrier squadron, sortieing!
331.15: It's not an AA defense! We're doing an air attack! Amagi, deploying aircraft!
331.17: Reppuu... those dazzling wings.. Oh, whoops, I'm smitten with my own planes.
331.18: What... A pursuit attack? Then... I'll do my best.
331.19: I got bombed!? Commence emergency procedures!
331.20: Hurry up with the flood control! I-I'm fine!
331.21: Uwa... I've been hit. It's impossible to launch planes now.
331.22: Even though...Amagi is sinking...Amagi still has this strange feeling... This time, I did my best...right...?
331.23: Amagi is...number one? Really? Thank you very much. I...I'm happy.
331.24: Admiral, did you call for Amagi? Huh? It's for Amagi? Then, I will accept it, Admiral. Th-thank you. I will treasure it.
331.25:
I'm Amagi, 2nd Carrier of the Unryuu-class.
My construction following the Rapid Naval
Armaments Supplement Program. Even
though I couldn't join the Mobile Striking
Force, I did my best in the air
raid at Kure Naval base.
331.27: Thank you, for all these precious fuel and aircraft.
331.28: Admiral,　good work as usual. Amagi's always on standby here, so... If you have any problems, just call me.
331.29: Hakodate... I wonder...? That's such a familiar name... Maybe it's just me...? Ah, Admiral! Did you call for me? Amagi will give her best!
331.3: What? Commencing anti-aircraft defense! Ara? Admiral? Um...well...
331.4: Admiral, what's wrong with Amagi's hangar? Deploying aircraft? Yes, I'm happy.
331.5: Looks like a new ship has joined the fleet.
331.7: The fleet has returned. Good work everyone.
331.8: Reports are important, right, Admiral? Amagi thinks so, too.
331.9: Shall we reinforce my anti-aircraft guns?
331.Anniversary 6547: Admiral, today is an important day, right? Amagi is honored to be with you! Fufu, I'm happy.

332.1:
I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the
Unryuu-Class Carriers! Eh?
'A floating anti-air gun platform'? I-It's
not like that...! What are you saying!
332.10: Yes, this'll help in the fight! I'm happy.
332.11: I'm going to the bath! You... don't you dare peek!
332.12: Eek... looks like this will take a while. Sorry, I'm going to the bath... I will kill you if you peek!
332.13: Aircraft carrier Katsuragi preparation complete! Ready for sortie!
332.14: Carrier task force flagship, Katsuragi, launching! Whee... I've always wanted to say something like that!
332.15: Yes!!! Enemy fleet sighted! Launching strike aircraft!
332.16: Enemy spotted! All AA gun... Wait that's wrong, again from the top!!! Attack force, covering force, prepare to deploy!
332.17: Attack force, starting! I... I'm a standard carrier!
332.18: Pursuing, huh? Going too far is restricted, but still sometimes needed... Alright, go!
332.19: No!? Is the flight deck ok? Prevent any secondary explosions! I... I don't want to sink!
332.2: I am a standard carrier. Got it?, a standard carrier!
332.20: I, Katsuragi, can not sink at such place! Such attacks...!
332.21: I was hit... But the engine room is still undamaged! Can operate without problems!
332.22: I see, this is sinking... cold... and lonely... bye-bye, everyone...
332.23: Eh? Me? Katsuragi is number one? Really? Um... thanks...
332.24: What is it, Admiral? Can you see that I quite busy here, because this engine requires a lot of maintenance... what... this is... Thank you! I...
332.25:
I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the
Unryuu-class Carriers! Yes, a standard
aircraft carrier. Looks like I was late.
But after the battle was over, I was working
at full power. In a sense, I am the best.
It's the truth! Really, it's true!
332.26: I'll give it all I've got!
332.27: Thanks for these valuable supplies. Yes, now I can head out again!
332.28: Admiral, hey, if only this aircraft was resupplied I would... Eh, what? Even if you look at me with such gentle eyes, nothing... it will gain you nothing! Geez~
332.29: I see I see, so this is Ryuusei Kai. Yup yup. I've heard about it... wait isn't that one a Reppuu? That's wonderful! They're perfect for me! Eh!?
332.3: Do you understand? Give me your best aircraft!
332.30: Um...Today I, standard carrier Katsuragi, will be your secretary. What? Got a problem? I have enough time to do time announcement at least, enough time!
332.31: 1:00 AM Is that okay? Are you listening? I see...then its fine! Alright!
332.32: Its 2:00 AM...Hey...You aren't listening to my announcements! I see...really? Then, that's okay.
332.33: 3:00 AM... See! You clearly didn't listen! Just what were you doing? ...huh, cooking?
332.34: It's 4:00 AM... What? Night meal for me? That's hot pot with udon... well, thank you. It's delicious but... why?
332.35: 5:00... Huh? Compared with my sister, the part that needs to stick out do not stick out, so I have to eat...? Y-You have done it! Any last word!?
332.36: It's 6:00 AM. Hah... just what were you looking at when you are looking at us shipgirls? That place is irrelevant with our ability to perform... good grief...!
332.37: It's 7:00 AM! I got mad at someone and get hungry as a result! You, you need to make breakfast... Isn't that right as a punishment? Yup punishment!
332.38: It's 8:00! No way, your breakfast is... delicious! Where did you learn?... Eh... Amagi-nee? R-Really?
332.39: It's 9:00. I really don't want to... But, a carrier's ability is not limited to her cooking! After all, a carrier is all about...
332.4: Wha... That's not my hanga... What are you doing anyway!? What do you want, you idiot!!
332.40: It's 10:00 AM! Ah! Zuikaku-senpai! Good work as always!... ah, I was nervous! Well it was Zuikaku-san, the one I admire!
332.41: 11:00 AM. Eh? What, it's true though! After all it's Zuikaku-san, the one I'm admiring! Isn't that wonderful...! I also like her camouflage, mine also matches hers!
332.42: 12:00 PM. Ah! It's already lunchtime!? What are you doing for lunch? Going to Mamiya's or...unnn...
332.43: 13:00 PM. Sometime it's good to go outside the harbor. You get a little of this disembark feeling... Ah! I-It's not like we're on a date or anything!
332.44: It's 14:00 AM. It's not what you think! You're such an idiot... but that Western-style shop is really good... I wouldn't mind going there again.
332.45: It's 15:00 PM! Ah, is Amagi-nee okay? Yup, I'm always perfect! Look! My maintenance is perfect, from my rocket launcher to the flight deck!
332.46: It's 16:00 PM! Eh? What? AA defense? That's my special of special trick! What? Show it right here? It's very flashy, you'll see!
332.47: 17:00 PM. It's already evening, after all that trick... Hah, I can't do any sortie or expedition...B-But I'll do it tomorrow!
332.48: 18:00 PM. Evening already... well... If it's okay I'll do something simple! Rice ball with salt, pickled raikon radish... wait, green leaves with miso soup is alright, right?
332.49: It's 19:00 PM. So? Is my riceball with sal... riceball seasoned with salt delicious? Of course, the level will only increase after this!
332.5: A new member has been added to the force! I'm curious!
332.50: 20:00. W-well sometime, I want to to go out as the main ship of the combined fleet... really.
332.51: 21:00. So, what is your dream like? Isn't it fine, just tell me! Eh? Really? Ehh... Uhm... So it's like that...
332.52: It's 22:00 PM. *humming* Eh? I'm not in a good mood, not such thing! I'm fine! I-am-fine! Ehehe
332.53: 23:00. Finally, today was perfect! Good work from you too! Tomorrow will come soon, so how about a little rest? Huh? You're not gonna?
332.6547: Somehow... doesn't fall seem a bit melancholic...? In a way? Eh? Amagi-nee, you love the fall? Why?
332.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned. Well done everyone!
332.8: Yup. reporting in is extremely important! Shall we go together?
332.9: T-That equipment is not too bad. Yup.
332.Anniversary 6547: I see. Today is an important day for us, right? It is for you, too... isn't it? Right?

334.1: Submarine U-511 of the German Navy,\nplease call me Yuu. I've come a long way,\nso I'll be in your care...
334.12: Let me rest a lot... Gute Nacht.
334.18: A night battle. I won't lose!

334.22: I can't...resurface anymore... I want to go back to Maizuru... back home... once more...
334.23: Yuu is number one? Danke. I understand. I'll work even harder.
334.24: Admiral... What's wrong? This ring... is for Yuu? Da, Danke. U-Um... Danke!
334.25:
I'm the... German Navy U-Boat, U-511.
I worked hard to come here. If I could be
friends... with everyone... and get
acquainted with this place's culture...
I think that'd be nice.
334.26: I feel like there's a ship I've seen before... maybe it's just me?
334.28: ???... Wait that's not it. Um... Admiral, thanks... as always.
334.29: ?…Admiral. Is Yuu... doing everything right? Oh... ...danke!
334.3: I know. That's the greeting in this fleet right? It's different.
334.4: "When in Rome, do as the Romans do" they said... Well, wonder what should I do.

34.1: I'm Akatsuki! Treat me like the\nfully-fledged lady that I am!
34.10: You say that this equipment is a bit big? It's obviously just the right size!
34.11: It's not that I'm tired or anything, you know.
34.12: I'm only being deployed to violent battles. How troubling...
34.13: It is my turn now, yes? Please observe.
34.18: We have no choice but to charge!
34.21: Ugh... geez, I won't forgive you... I seriously won't!
34.22: To sink in a place like this... I can't stand it...
34.23: No matter how you look at it, it's clear that I'm the best!
34.24: To dine alone with the commander, as a lady... Huh? Why do I only have juice? Furthermore, why does the pilaf have a flag on it...!

I'm the 1st of the special type-III
destroyers, Akatsuki. Based on the
Fubuki-class, with improved performance
and range, the last word in destroyers!
I'm quite the lady, you know!
R-really, I am....
34.27: Thank you. You have my regards.
34.28: C-Co-Co-Commander! For working so hard, I shall offer you my praise. Please lower your head.
34.3: Today is certainly an auspicious day.
34.4: Don't pat my head like that! Didn't I say that I'm not a child anymore?
34.5: A new ship has been finished.

34.8: A telegram for the commander. Hurry and read it.
34.9: Thank you. You have my regards.
34.Anniversary 6547: Commander, congratulation for the third anniversary. I shall celebrate it as a first class lady.
34.Rainy 6547: So it's the rainy season. It feels a little disheartening... Ah, Inazuma, is that a teru teru bozu? Not half bad!
34.Summer 6547: Geez! Building a sandcastle is no joke, you know! It's a way to practice building an elegant coastal fortification.

343.1: I'm Katori, a Training Cruiser. Don't you\nworry... I'll be gentle in teaching you various\nthings.
343.10: Yeah, my armaments are actually that heavy. Ufufu.
343.11: It's not a big problem but... My clothes got ripped a bit...
343.12: Well, please excuse me then. I will head to the bath first.

343.20: Arghhhh! I can still fight! Don't worry!
343.21: I'm beat... But my gun still works... I'll rain shells on them!
343.22: It's...no good... At least, I got launched...aa..ah...

First of the Katori-class training cruisers,
Katori. Right, leave the ocean navigation
training to me. I believe I'll be a great help
in furthering what the fleet attains out of
its drills, for sure. Eh, my firepower in
comparison to a battleship... is it?
I wonder, tactics-wise, how it is.
343.27: Thanks. From now on, I can navigate the ocean at any time.
343.28: Admiral, is there something wrong? Are you tired? If that's so, would you like to go to a sea a little faraway with Katori? When this battle is over, for sure...
343.29: Preparing for the next ocean voyage...alright! I'll be thorough. Admiral...oh, you're busy...Well, I, uh...I guess it's no matter.
343.3: Should I go on ocean navigation training?
343.30: Today, Training Cruiser Katori will be your secretary, right? Admiral, I'll be in your care.
343.31: 01:00. It's hard to believe how quiet this port becomes at night... During the day, it was so noisy...
343.32: 02:00. Tomorrow will come soon. How about some rest, Admiral?
343.33: 03:00. Admiral? You should lie down and rest. Leave the rest of the work to me.
343.34: 04:00. Admiral? It's almost dawn. It's the darkest before dawn, right? Ufufu~

343.38: 08:00. Time for the fleet to work! First is some expeditions, right? While we're at it, should we add some...ocean navigation?
343.39: 09:00. Ah... But if I were to navigate the ocean then... Who would be here with you...? Th-That's right, let's do it another time.
343.4: Ara... Hoho...? I see. Looks like you need a little discipline...
343.40: 10:00. About the torpedo squadron... Oh, this expedition is ok? And this is... Oh, we need to resupply, too... what should we do about development?
343.41: 11:00. Admiral... Thank you very much! I was nervous at things I'm not familiar with but... I'll get used to it soon.
343.42: 12:00. What shall we eat for lunch? Can I do it as long as it's simple?
343.43: 13:00. Do you want more of Katori's curry? It's different from others' curry, right? Ufufufu
343.44: 14:00. Ara? What's wrong, Maikaze? It's a little lonely...? Nowaki is not with you today?
343.45: 15:00. Huh...about Maikaze? She's such a good girl! Of course, Nowaki is too.
343.46: 16:00. What? Ah...about this? It's not a main gun, it's a ceremonial saluting gun... Shall I shoot it?
343.47: 17:00. The sun is about to set... Let us return to the base.
343.48: 18:00. Good work today, Admiral. What do you wish for your dinner? Fufu... Roger that! I shall now prepare.
343.49: 19:00. Now then, eat up! It's different from Ashigara's, right? How does it taste?
343.5: Admiral, looks like we have a new important ship girl for ocean navigation.
343.50: 20:00. Can you wait, Admiral? I'm washing at the moment... Ara... It's as if we are a married couple... Ufufu
343.51: 21:00. Admiral? Is there a problem? You're putting on such a troubled face... 'Don't worry'? We're always with you, Admiral.
343.52: 22:00. Guu... That girl is being noisy again, today! Don't stop me, Admiral! I'm gonna teach her a lesson!
343.53: 23:00. Night time is here. Good work, Admiral. Shall we have some sake? And then good night.
343.7: The fleet has returned. Good work everyone.
343.8: Admiral, you want a situation report? That's very important; the report is right here.
343.9: An upgrade for Katori? I'm very thankful.

344.4: Cut it out, Kiyoshimo! I told you to stop!... Wait, that's the commander! You better prepare yourself! Put your hands against the wall! Here I go!
344.5: Looks like a new ally's arrived—
344.7: The fleet's back safely! Stop looking so relieved!
344.8: Report huh? Must be important... Here
344.9: Oh, you're very thoughtful! Good good!

345.10: With this... with this I can maybe fight!
345.11: I'm sorry, I might need the bath.

I'm Takanami, the sixth Yuugumo-class
Destroyer. Born in Uraga. I was assigned to
the 31st Destroyer Division, and I had
done my part well. On a fateful night
battle at Lunga Point, as the Leadship
of the Lookouts squad, our crew first
spotted the enemy fleet... and that may
have brought victory to the battle... Yup!
345.27: Maybe I'm happy... with these precious supplies.
345.28: Commander, are you a little tired? Just wait a moment, Takanami will put in some Tea! Yes, it's Japanese Tea! Commander, just take a little rest!
345.29: Drum cans, Drum cans... Oh, we have them. Me? I might not be equipping those, because I'm the leading look out ship! What? What you mean by that? Um... I don't know
345.3: Commander? Maybe... did you call for Takanami?
345.30: Admiral! I, Takanami might announce the time today. Ah! We just passed 0:00 AM!

345.32: Maybe it's 2... AM! Ah? It's okay? I'm sorry it's a bad habit. Yup.

345.41: Maybe it's 11:00 AM. Commander, it's time for lunch. What do you want?

345.44: 14:00 Next expedition might be... Tokyo Express? Eh... ah... it's... nothing...
345.45: 15:0... Ah! Naganami-neesama! Eh? Refreshment? Thanks you!
345.46: 16:00. I received cookies from Naganami-neesama! For now, I'll brew some tea
345.47: 17:00. Such a wonderful sunset...! The sun might set at any moment. It might looks pretty.

345.49: 19:00. Dinner's preparation is probably done. We have Fricandeau Beef today...

345.51: 21:00. Maybe it's night. Commander, I'll brew some tea again, yup!

345.53: 23:00. Commander, good work today... probably. Yup!

346.1:
I'm Takanami, the sixth Yuugumo-class
Destroyer. Born in Uraga. I was assigned to
the 31st Destroyer Division, and I had
done my part well. On a fateful night
battle at Lunga Point, as the Leadship
of the Lookouts squad, our crew first
spotted the enemy fleet... and that may
have brought victory to the battle... Yup!

353.1: Guten Morgen!　I am the carrier, Graf Zeppelin.\nYou are the Admiral overseeing this fleet, yes?\nIs that so...... Roger.

353.31: 01...0-0. This will do, yes? Leave it in my hands. There will be no issues.
353.32: 02...0-0. Hmm... flawless. Admiral. Admiral? Are there any further tasks for me? As your secretary ship, expect nothing but the best.
353.33: 03...0-0. Understood! You desire coffee, yes? Entrust it to me. Prepare to taste the most supreme of coffees. I am quite confident when it comes to the aroma and flavor of coffee.

353.42: 12...0-0. Oh...? So this is "Mamiya". The menu... has variety. Admiral, what is your recommendation? Curry, you say? Right! I shall order it.
353.43: 13...0-0. The curry from lunch was quite a memorable dish. So the fleet here is able to have that every day, yes? I see. Hmm....
353.44: 14...0... Ah, Bismarck, you are stationed here as well. I am still new to the area— please teach me all you know. Ah... that... will do for now.
353.45: 15...0-0. This country has a unique culture. Admiral, I will diligently study as much of it as I am able, just as that U-boat has done.
353.46: 16...0-0. So these are... "Shoukaku" and "Zuikaku". They are quite the sight. So they are the "final form" of this country's carriers... Hmmm...
353.47: 17...0-0. The sun is setting. The setting sun is beautiful no matter the sea you are in. Admiral, what is it? Is there something on my face?
353.48: 18...0-0. For dinner today... ah, I have been invited to a "standard-carrier-banquet"... Admiral, would you like to join me?
353.49: 19...0-0. Ah, Akagi. My gratitude for inviting me to the dinner banquet this evening. Danke. What... is that? "Hot pot", you say? Such an unusual cuisine.
353.50: 20...0-0. "Hot pot"... Is this similar to a pot-au-feu? Why is everyone surrounding the hot pot? Taihou, teach me. How should I eat it?
353.51: 21...0-0. That was a strange banquet. However... mm, I found it quite enjoyable. Admiral, this fleet is... I believe I will enjoy it here.
353.52: 22...0-0. Admiral, the evening has advanced to night. Now then, let us begin drawing today's work to a close. Shall I make some coffee?
353.53: 23...0-0. Admiral, today was quite a day, yes? Let us work hard tomorrow as well. Gute nacht.

406.1: Unryuu class aircraft carrier, Unryuu is here.\nAdmiral, please leave the future of the task force to me!

406.14: Unryuu class transport ship, they say? What a joke. I shall show you my true power.

406.17: Stay alert for submarines. Don't let down your guard.
406.20: A direct hit!? Engine room! Deploy the power reserves!

406.23: Unryuu is the most valuable ship? I see...Hnn, I'm happy, it feels good....

I'll show you the immense potential of the main force of the reborn Mobile Task Force.
406.27: Resupply eh...Please refill my aircraft too.
406.28: Admiral, though the battle this time is unavoidable, ease your shoulders and relax a little bit. I'll always be beside you... So it's okay.

406.32: 0200. Admiral, it would be better to take a rest now.

406.39: 0900. What would be good for carrier-based aircraft? Tenzan... ? Ryuusei...? Reppuus are fine too.

406.40: 1000. Admiral, the currently loaded airframes are quite... Um, uh...
406.41: 1100. Admiral, what would be good for lunch? I shall prepare it.
406.42: 1200. I made onigiri for lunchtime combat rations. How is it?
406.43: 1300. Admiral, was the lunch a bit too simple? I'm sorry...
406.44: 1400. Admiral, of course I don't mind the transport missions, but the cargo... err....
406.45: 1500. I see. But carrying such highly volatile cargo is somewhat... yes...
406.46: 1600. Admiral, I'm feeling nervous in this hour. As I thought, one should be more alert to the presence of submarines.
406.47: 1700. Phew... it's a relief once we get past this hour. I was a little nervous.
406.48: 1800. Admiral, it's time for dinner. What would you like? Er...
406.49: 1900. What's the matter, Shigure? Eh, provisions? Thank you, you saved me.

406.51: 2100. Admiral, we have already had it for lunch. But Shigure's onigiri is delicious, isn't it? Ufufu.
406.52: Now is 2200, Admiral. It's completely night & becoming much quieter now.
406.53: Admiral, Unryuu reports that it's now 2300. Thank you very much for today.

406.8: Information? Let me have a look... Hmm, I see.
406.9: New planes really boosts morale, huh.

407.21: Hah... I'm still able to sail... I can... still keep fighting!

407.4: It'll be great if we can avoid air raids even a little bit. Admiral, would you like to paint yourself, too?

407.8: Want to analyze the intelligence? I'll go get it.
407.9: This is... this is modernization... ...isn't it?

408.4: Oohh~, that's a long face, Admiral. That's no good! Drink some of this! Here, here.

409.21: Like this, it can't be helped. Isn't there a good sandbar around?

409.28: Commander. I think you're working a bit too much too. Umm... Sometimes, together, we should... Uu... I-it's nothing... Uu

409.33: 0300. Pulling an all-nighter will harm your body, Commander. Rest for awhile.
409.34: 0400. The blue of the morning sky. I don't hate it, but it's a little cold right now.
409.35: 0500. I'm sorry, was my hand cold to the touch?

409.42: 1200. How was... the meat stew? There's enough... For seconds.

409.44: 1400. Commander, am I... Mistaken about anything? Oh, I see. It's fine then.
409.45: 1500. It's time for... Some snacks. Caramel... I don't hate it.
409.46: 1600. The caramel was delicious. Makigumo-nee-san... You ate too much.
409.47: 1700. Commander, fighting a losing battle is detestable isn't it? No more...
409.48: 1800. I'll make dinner. It's not something to be made light of... It's curry.
409.49: 1900. I added some coconuts from the southern islands into my curry. Fufu...
409.5: More battle strength is needed... again... they increased.
409.50: 2000. There's enough curry for every girl, so please help yourself to it.
409.51: 2100. Commander, how was Hayashimo's curry? Fufu...Fufufufu...
409.52: 2200. Ah, Nachi-san brought the whiskey bottle. Will you drink some?
409.53: 2300. When I'm together with the commander... I'll... Forget about all these unpleasant happening.
409.6: The repair... right... Repair is repair.
409.7: The fleet returned. Fu...Fufufu. They returned.
409.8: Commander, you'll look at the data? I see...
409.9: Stronger... will anything change if I get stronger?

41.1: Fourth ship of the Hatsuharu class,\nHatsushimo. Everyone, I'm very pleased\nto meet you!

Fourth of the Hatsuharu-class destroyers,
Hatsushimo. I was in lots of hard battles
like the Operation AL, the Battle of the
Komandorski Islands, the occupation of
Kiska, the Battle of the Philippine Sea,
Operation Hoku-Go and Ten-Ichi-Go!
I really did my best!

I wasn't around for long but I took part in several fleet actions. Leyte was, of course, apalling to see but I even took part in Operation Rei-gou! How's that?

Right?

413.30: Commander! It's gotten pretty late... I'll keep you company for today. It just became midnight, after all!
413.31: It's 0100! The night's a bit cold...
413.32: It's 0200...? What's with that face...? I'm not particularly sleepy or anything. you know?
413.33: It's 0300...? Commander... are you feeling drowsy? You have terrible bags under your eyes... Are you not getting enough sleep? Its fine if you have a nap, I'll be on night watch from here on.

413.45: Its 1500 huh...Ah! It's Kirishima-san! Welcome back! Yes, Asagumo has been doing well! Yes!

413.47: 1700. It's about time to prepare dinner. Ah don't worry, I'll prepare it! I said I'll do it, don't worry about it!

424.Summer 6547: It's summer, Commander. I may want to eat some red beans on ice. Mamiya-san... Ah, I'll serve it!

425.1: Yo! I'm Asashimo, 16th Destroyer of the Yuugumo Class.\nPlease remember. Don't forget about me... ok?
425.10: I don't want to be not prepared, upgrade are welcome!
425.11: Well... it's really just a scratch! Yeah.

425.17: Asashimo will take you on! More! Even more! Bring it!!

425.20: Tskkk...! Nah nah I can still fight!
425.21: Damn, I got hit! Engine is... fine! Then I can still fight! I can continue!

425.24: Hey, Admiral. Do you have business with me? What is it, can it be resolved by asking someone else? What, a ring? Wow it looks good! I'll take it! It's alright isn't it ♪
425.25: I'm the 16th Destroyer of the Yuugumo Class, Asashimo. Remember it well.\nI made my debut when the war situation got worse. I ran about freely at the front lines of the end stage. I did...all I could!
425.27: Oh, thanks a bunch! Fuel and ammo are important, after all!
425.28: What's the matter, Admiral? You look down. Alright! I'll perk you up. Hmm? Want me to sing a song? Hmm?
425.29: ...Hey, if you're leaving me alone like this, you must have something else important to do, right? I don't like it... but, I forgive you!
425.3: Ah, you can leave it to me. I'm fine with escorts or even nighttime raids!
425.4: Cut it out, Kiyoshimo! I told you to stop!... Wait, that's the commander! You better prepare yourself! Put your hands against the wall! Here I go!
425.5: Looks like a new ally's arrived—
425.7: The fleet's back safely! Stop looking so relieved!
425.8: Report huh? Must be important... Here
425.9: Oh, you're very thoughtful! Good good!
425.Anniversary 1471: Yo! I heard it's the third anniversary. Dang, that's the bee's knees! Commander, treat me something as a celebration. Come on!
425.Anniversary 6547: Yeah! Today is special day! Alright! Commander, let's celebrate together, ok?
425.Rainy 6547: Ahhh, seriously...? It's still raining. Somehow I feel restless just staying indoors. Aarrrgh! What's up with that?

426.1: はじめまして吹雪です。\nThanks for having me today as well.
426.10: This equipment... with this, I'll do even better!
426.18: Transitioning to pursuit attack. Please follow me!
426.2: Is it time to sortie? I'll do my best!

427.1: I am Choukai. My best regards.
427.10: This equipment... it feels pretty good!
427.12: As expected, looks like I overdid it a little.
427.13: Heavy Cruiser Choukai of the Eight Fleet, going!
427.14: Off we go! Let's do this!

427.16: Target enemy fleet straight ahead! Preparing... commence fire!

427.19: Ouch! Bridge is taking hit!? Err...I'm fine! I can still fight!

427.27: Yes, I'm always thankful for the supply!
427.28: I am always thankful towards you. Being with you, it is a honor.

427.3: Do you have anything for me yet?
427.4: Oh, this is mission as well?
427.5: Newbie, huh? Is the commander interested too?

427.7: There's a report on the operation's completion.

428.1: Yo! Name's Maya, nice to meet you.
428.11: Pulling me back, will the fleet be okay?
428.12: Using me until I'm like this... dammit!
428.13: Oh, here I go! Air defense cruiser Maya! Setting sail!
428.14: I'm the awesome air defense cruiser, Maya! Anti-aircraft warfare? You can count on me! Just hide behind me!
428.16: Hehee...feel the might of a brand new me!
428.18: Looks like you're getting on my nerves, bub.
428.20: The hell...!? Don't mess with me!
428.21: Don't joke with me! J...just wait and see!
428.22: Sinking...huh... I had such a simple life...
428.23: Isn't it obvious? I'm Maya the Awesome, you know?
428.24: Thanks for always using my full power, man. This too... I thank...you.

428.3: Admiral~ calm down a bit will ya? Why dontcha just follow MY example! ...Eh? "You're one to talk"!?
428.5: I heard there's a newbie. Let's take care of her!
428.9: Yeaaah! I'm fired up! Here I go!

429.1: I'm Amagi, an Unryuu-class Carrier!\nAdmiral, this time Amagi can play an active role!
429.10: Amagi is thankful for the new aircraft. Thank you very much.
429.11: It's not a serious wound but...thanks, Admiral.
429.12: I'm sorry. I'm going to take a lot of time in the bath. I'm truly... sorry.
429.13: First Carrier fleet, renewed! Amagi, going!
429.17: Reppuu... those dazzling wings.. Oh, whoops, I'm smitten with my own planes.
429.18: What... A pursuit attack? Then... I'll do my best.
429.19: I got bombed!? Commence emergency procedures!
429.20: Hurry up with the flood control! I-I'm fine!
429.21: Uwa...I've been hit. It's impossible to launch planes now.
429.22: Even though...Amagi is sinking...Amagi still has this strange feeling...This time, I did my best...right...?
429.23: Fuu... Amagi is happy with the result of the battle! Amagi can do it, as long as I give my best effort!
429.24: Admiral, did you call for Amagi? Huh? It's for Amagi? Then, I will accept it, Admiral. Th-thank you. I will treasure it.
429.25: I'm Amagi, second Carrier of the Unryuu Class.\nMy construction following the Rapid Naval Armaments Supplement Program. Even though I couldn't join the Mobile Striking Force, I did my best in the air raid at Kure Naval base.
429.27: Thank you, for all these precious fuel & aircraft.
429.28: Admiral, thank you for giving Amagi these wonderful aircraft... And for including me in the main force. Really, thank you very much!... I'm full of gratitude.
429.29: Hakodate... I wonder...? That's such a familiar name... Maybe it's just me...? Ah, Admiral! Did you call for me? Amagi will give her best!
429.3: What? Commencing anti-aircraft defense! Huh? Admiral? Um...well...
429.30: Admiral! The day has changed! Today, Amagi will announce the hourlies! Yes, don't worry! I'll do my best!
429.31: 01:00. Admiral... The fleet is quiet tonight!
429.32: 02:00. It's... Midnight... 'Are you scared'? No... I... am... not...? Admiral...? Where are you...? Hyaa!?
429.33: 03:00. Admiral? Um? Can you stop toying with me? Amagi was really surprised... It's not like I was scared...
429.34: 04:00. Admiral? It's very sleepy at this time... Ufu! I'm doing my best!
429.35: 05:00. It's dawn now... Shall we prepare for the reveille?
429.36: 06:00. Commencing reveille! It's morning! Let us give our best today, too!
429.37: 07:00. Admiral! I'm sorry for making such a simple dish but... breakfast is here! Today the soup for miso is...
429.38: 08:00. Admiral? Did Amagi's breakfast match your taste? Ah... great... I'll be cleaning now... Thanks...
429.39: 09:00. Admiral! It's about time we do some battles. What shall we pick for the main fleet?
429.4: Admiral, what's wrong with Amagi's hangar? 'Checking the condition of the aircraft'...? Really?
429.40: 10:00. That's right... I'm happy I get to equip aircraft! They're beautiful... aircraft that is.
429.41: 11:00. It's about time for lunch, right? What do you want, Admiral...? I wonder what I should make...
429.42: 12:00. It's noon, now! Admiral, I tried making Japanese-style curry for lunch! Please eat up, I still have a lot left.
429.43: 13:00. My curry was good, too, right? Of course, the soup & the potato starch were on point, as well.
429.44: 14:00. Ah... Unryuu-neesama! How are you, today? You're getting more beautiful these days... Amagi want to be like you, too!
429.45: 15:00. Admiral, do you want some sweets? I've ordered some Kudzu starch cake from Mamiya! Let us dig in!
429.46: 16:00. Admiral, if Amagi trains hard, can Amagi match Hiryuu & Souryuu? Huh? Really...? Then, Amagi will do her best!
429.47: 17:00. Admiral, the sunset was beautiful, right...? Um... Amagi is also... Noooo, what am I saying... Let's go back... Yes...
429.48: 18:00. Admiral, shall Amagi prepare your dinner? Amagi will show you her culinary skills! Please wait!
429.49: 19:00. Amagi tried a Western-style dinner! It's cutlet & corn soup, today.
429.5: Looks like a new ship has joined the fleet.
429.50: 20:00. Hah? 'Cutlet is different from tonkatsu'? Huh? 'How'? Well, first off... It's...
429.51: 21:00. Admiral! Yeah... About our sister Katsuragi? Yes, I believe we will meet again, & I want to form a carrier division with her.
429.52: 22:00. It's quiet at night... Well, looks like it's not... shall Amagi go & make it quiet?
429.53: 23:00. Admiral, thanks for your hard work today. Please have some sleep.
429.7: The fleet has returned. Good work everyone.
429.8: Reports are important, right, Admiral? Amagi thinks so, too.
429.9: Shall we reinforce my anti-aircraft guns?

43.1: I'm Shigure, of the Shiratsuyu-class\ndestroyers. Nice to meet you.
43.10: Oxygen torpedoes, huh... sure, I'll take them.
43.11: Thank you. I'll be going in, then.
43.12: I've troubled everyone... I'll make up for it. I promise.
43.20: Stop it. That hurts, you know?
43.21: To be able to corner me like this... well, so it goes.
43.22: Looks like this is it for me... Admiral... everyone... good bye.
43.23: I only played a small part in this victory. It was the rain and... well, it's thanks to you, Admiral.
43.24: The rain... looks like it isn't stopping. Admiral, you'll get soaked over there, you know? Why don't you come a little closer? Until the rain lifts, let's stay like this.
43.25:
I'm Shigure, second ship of the
Shiratsuyu-class destroyers.
I was in the fated battle of Surigao Strait
under the Nishimura fleet in the battle of
Leyte Gulf. Fusou and Yamashiro were
amazing... Even if everyone forgets,
I'll always remember them...
43.28: A hard-working admiral is great as well. Still, don't push yourself too hard, okay?
43.29: Am I still supposed to be here...?
43.4: You're interested in me? ...Sure. You can ask me whatever you want.
43.5: A new ship has been built.
43.6547: Admiral, summer has come to an end... I'm fine. Fall is also... a nice season.
43.7: The fleet has returned safely. Thank goodness.
43.9: Thanks. Looks like I've become a little stronger.
43.Anniversary 6547: Admiral, It's our third anniversary right? It's been a long time, but I feel like it was over in a flash. Yup.
43.NotFall 6547: Fall is... a bit lonely, huh? Ah... nah, I'm fine.
43.Rainy 6547: Admiral... there's no such thing as an endless rain... so... please don't worry... I will always be there for you. You don't mind if I... stay by your side, right?
43.Summer 6547: Summer's closing in this year, huh? A swimsuit? Oh, I have last year's, so I'm fine.

430.1: Aircraft carrier Katsuragi, heading forth!\nEh? 'A floating anti-air gun platform'?\nI-It's not like that...! What are you saying!
430.10: Yes, this'll help in the fight! I'm happy.
430.11: I'm going to the bath! You... don't you dare peek!
430.12: Eek... looks like this will take a while. Sorry, I'm going to the bath... I will kill you if you peek!
430.13: Aircraft carrier Katsuragi and all aircraft, ahead! I will show you the true power of the remodeled Hiryuu-class!!
430.14: Carrier task force flagship, Katsuragi, launching! Whee... I've always wanted to say something like that!
430.15: Yes!!! Enemy fleet sighted! Here I go! First stike wave, launch all aircraft!
430.16: Enemy spotted! All AA gun... Wait that's wrong, again from the top!!! Attack force, covering force, prepare to deploy!
430.17: Attack force, starting! I... I'm a standard carrier!
430.18: Pursuing, huh? Going too far is restricted, but still sometimes needed... Alright, go!
430.19: No!? Is the flight deck ok? Prevent any secondary explosions! I... I don't want to sink!
430.2: That's right! Standard Carrier! Main Force! Main Force!
430.20: I, Katsuragi, can not sink at such place! Such attacks...!
430.21: I was hit... But the engine room is still undamaged! Can operate without problems!
430.22: I see, this is sinking... cold... and lonely... bye-bye, everyone...
430.23: Me again? Sorry... Katsuragi unintentionally took first place. Sorry!
430.24: What is it, Admiral? Can you see that I quite busy here, because this engine requires a lot of maintenance... what... this is... Thank you! I...
430.25: I'm Katsuragi, the third ship of the Unryuu-Class Carriers!\nYes, a standard aircraft carrier. Looks like I was late. But after the battle was over, I was working at full power. In a sense, I am the best. It's the truth! Really it's true!
430.26: I'll give it all I've got!
430.27: Thanks for these valuable supplies. Yes, now I can head out again!
430.28: Admiral, hey, if only this aircraft was resupplied I would... Eh, what? Even if you look at me with such gentle eyes, nothing... it will gain you nothing! Geez~
430.29: I see I see, so this is Ryuusei Kai. Yup yup. I've heard about it... wait isn't that one a Reppuu? That's wonderful! They're perfect for me! Eh!?
430.3: Do you understand? Give me your best aircraft!
430.30: Um...Today I, standard carrier Katsuragi, will be your secretary. What? Got a problem? I have enough time to do time announcement at least, enough time!
430.31: 1:00 AM Is that okay? Are you listening? I see...then its fine! Alright!
430.32: Its 2:00 AM...Hey...You aren't listening to my announcements! I see...really? Then, that's okay.
430.33: 3:00 AM... See! You clearly didn't listen! Just what were you doing? ...huh, cooking?
430.34: It's 4:00 AM... What? Night meal for me? That's hot pot with udon... well, thank you. It's delicious but... why?
430.35: 5:00... Huh? Compared with my sister, the part that needs to stick out do not stick out, so I have to eat...? Y-You have done it! Any last word!?
430.36: It's 6:00 AM. Hah... just what were you looking at when you are looking at us shipgirls? That place is irrelevant with our ability to perform... good grief...!
430.37: It's 7:00 AM! I got mad at someone and get hungry as a result! You, you need to make breakfast... Isn't that right as a punishment? Yup punishment!
430.38: It's 8:00! No way, your breakfast is... delicious! Where did you learn?... Eh... Amagi-nee? R-Really?
430.39: It's 9:00. I really don't want to... But, a carrier's ability is not limited to her cooking! After all, a carrier is all about...
430.4: I told you that's not my hangar! How many times did I-uuu... This time I'm not forgiving you!
430.40: It's 10:00 AM! Ah! Zuikaku-senpai! Good work as always!... ah, I was nervous! Well it was Zuikaku-san, the one I admire!
430.41: 11:00 AM. Eh? What, it's true though! After all it's Zuikaku-san, the one I'm admiring! Isn't that wonderful...! I also like her camouflage, mine also matches hers!
430.42: 12:00 PM. Ah! It's already lunchtime!? What are you doing for lunch? Going to Mamiya's or...unnn...
430.43: 13:00 PM. Sometime it's good to go outside the harbor. You get a little of this disembark feeling... Ah! I-It's not like we're on a date or anything!
430.44: It's 14:00 AM. It's not what you think! You're such an idiot... but that Western-style shop is really good... I wouldn't mind going there again.
430.45: It's 15:00 PM! Ah, is Amagi-nee okay? Yup, I'm always perfect! Look! My maintenance is perfect, from my rocket launcher to the flight deck!
430.46: It's 16:00 PM! Eh? What? AA defense? That's my special of special trick! What? Show it right here? It's very flashy, you'll see!
430.47: 17:00 PM. It's already evening, after all that trick... Hah, I can't do any sortie or expedition...B-But I'll do it tomorrow!
430.48: 18:00 PM. Evening already... well... If it's okay I'll do something simple! Rice ball with salt, pickled raikon radish... wait, green leaves with miso soup is alright, right?
430.49: It's 19:00 PM. So? Is my riceball with sal... riceball seasoned with salt delicious? Of course, the level will only increase after this!
430.5: A new member has been added to the force! I'm curious!
430.50: 20:00. W-well sometime, I want to to go out as the main ship of the combined fleet... really.
430.51: 21:00. So, what is your dream like? Isn't it fine, just tell me! Eh? Really? Ehh... Uhm... So it's like that...
430.52: It's 22:00 PM. *humming* Eh? I'm not in a good mood, not such thing! I'm fine! I-am-fine! Ehehe
430.53: 23:00. Finally, today was perfect! Good work from you too! Tomorrow will come soon, so how about a little rest? Huh? You're not gonna?
430.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned. Well done everyone!
430.8: Yup. reporting in is extremely important! Shall we go together?
430.9: T-That equipment is not too bad. Yup.

431.1: Submarine U-511 of the German Navy, please call me Yuu.\nI've come a long way, so I'll be in your care...
431.12: Let me rest a lot... Gute Nacht.
431.18: A night battle. I won't lose!
431.21: I got beat. This isn't good. Yuu feels like she wants to resurface...
431.22: I can't...resurface anymore... I want to go back to Maizuru... back home... once more...
431.23: Yuu is number one? Danke. I understand. I'll work even harder.
431.24: Admiral... What's wrong? This ring... is for Yuu? Da, Danke. U-Um... Danke!
431.25: I'm the... German Navy U-Boat, U-511.\nI worked hard to come here.\nIf I could be friends... with everyone... and get acquainted with this place's culture... I think that'd be nice.
431.26: I feel like there's a ship I've seen before... maybe it's just me?
431.28: ???... Wait that's not it. Um... Admiral, thanks... as always.
431.29: ?…Admiral. Is Yuu... doing everything right? Oh... ...danke!
431.3: I know. That's the greeting in this fleet right? It's different.
431.4: "When in Rome, do as the Romans do" they said... Well, wonder what should I do.
431.Anniversary 6547: Yuu had fun today, too. It seems like Bismarck-neesan enjoyed herself, too. But... I may have eaten too much...

432.1: Guten Morgen. I am the aircraft carrier, Graf Zeppelin. \nYou are the admiral overseeing this fleet, yes?\nIs that so? Roger.
432.10: Oh...? This carrier-based plane... indeed... danke.
432.11: I shall briefly cleanse my rigging and myself. That is not a problem, is it?
432.12: Apologies. I have sustained heavy damage. Please allow me to enter the docks.
432.13: Aircraft carrier Graf Zeppelin, sortieing! Lichten des ankers!
432.14: Excellent. You may entrust this task force to me. Flagship Graf Zeppelin, setting sail.
432.15: We've spotted the enemy, have we? Wonderful. Strike squadron, depart at once! Break their formation!
432.16: Launch all capable planes! Hahaha! How thrilling.
432.19: Ughh! What the...? A direct hit?!
432.2: Am I to depart? So be it.
432.20: A hit? The flight deck? Suppress explosions!
432.21: Tch! They got me. And yet, my cannons still function! If it comes to a night battle... Admiral!
432.22: I'm... sinking in a fleet battle... am I? Ha...hah...! So be it! ...Just what is... this feeling... ha... heheh...
432.23: I, Graf Zeppelin, have brought you the greatest battle results? I see. Hmm...
432.24: Admiral? What is it? How may I, Graf Zeppelin, aid you? Ahh... this is...? For me? It is a thing of beauty. Are you sure? I see...
432.25: First of the Graf Zeppelin-class carriers, Graf Zeppelin. Capable of undertaking three-dimensional commerce raiding, I am a heavily armed and full-scale carrier. It seems that the technology used in the Japanese carrier, Akagi, was also referenced in my construction. A Japanese fleet, huh. I'm looking forward to it.
432.27: Resupply is vital at all times, no? This will help.
432.28: Admiral? Is there something on your mind? I see. That's fine, then... If you wish to consult with me on commerce raiding... Actually, if there is anything at all, do not hesitate to talk to me about it. Feel free.
432.29: The Messerschmitt... it has a fine airframe. The Focke-Wulf is an extremely powerful fighter, too... Mm. This fleet's airframes as well... ...The a-admiral is also... rather good. N-No, not at all. I said nothing.
432.3: What is it? You seem to be concerned. These flight decks are continually being maintained by me, personally. There is no need to worry.
432.4: What is the meaning of this? This is not a custom of your fleet, is it? An explanation, if you please.
432.5: Hmm... a new ship? From this arsenal, many ships have been born. How lively.
432.6547: Mm. The Autumn Festival? I've heard of it. In my country, we call it Oktoberfest. I shall look forward to it.
432.7: Admiral, the fleet has returned. Yes, the operation is complete.
432.8: Admiral? Ah, you wish to examine the latest intelligence? Roger.
432.9: Na gut. This is a fine plane. Hmm...
432.Rainy 6547: It has been raining quite a bit lately. I remember that it was at this time of year that they initially decided to halt my construction. It was infuriating. Ah, no. It's ancient history. Please forget it.
432.Summer 6547: So this is what this country's summer is like? This so-called "watermon-splitting" fighting style is of interest to me. One day I must experience it.
432.Yasen attack: Allow me to demonstrate that I am no mere carrier.
432.Yasen flagship: Haha...! A night battle, is it? So be it. I will show you that I, Graf Zeppelin, am no ordinary carrier. Fleet, follow after me. Pursue!

434.13: Flagship, assuming control! Ship of the fleet, Mutsuki, dashing into the fray!
434.15: This remodeled Mutsuki's battle... starts here! Commence firing!
434.18: This remodeled Mutsuki has the battle under control!
434.20: Fueeh... my armor hasn't changed that much, though...
434.21: Nyanya... t-this much damage won't stop the new me...!

435.17: You're such a problem child, aren't you? Kisaragi will make it all better♪
435.18: If you fall for this remodeled Kisaragi, I'll have to... do it♥

435.8: Are you going to make sure? And so? How-was-it~?

I participated in the Battle of Guadalcanal, as part of the Second Torpedo Squadron. I will be in your care, Admiral.

458.39: Admiral, it is 0900. I have finished checking today's fleet composition and expeditions. What will you do about the morning's sortie?

458.40: Admiral, it is 1000. Will you send the fleet to the South? Oh, should we prioritize the supply transport mission?

458.49: Admiral, it is 1900. Your evening meal is ready. Tonight's menu is chicken rice. How is it? Is it good?

458.51: Admiral, it's 2100. Ah... I'm a bit worried about Kawakaze. If anything really happened...
458.52: Admiral, it's 2200. Kawakaze made it back to the port safely, thank goodness. Thank you for your hard work too, Sendai-san!
458.53: Admiral, it is 2300. It has been a hard day of work today. Let's keep our diligence tomorrow too.
458.6547: Fall potatoes taste delicious, don't they? Admiral, shall I make steamed sweet potatoes? I'll prepare some tea as well. One moment, please.
458.7: Fleet has returned safely to port. Thank you for the hard work! Phew...

458.9: Thank you very much, Admiral. I'm happy to become stronger.

458.Summer 6547: Admiral, it's summer. The sunlight is really strong, isn't it? Oh, I'll be fine. I'll put on sunscreen just in case. Ehehe♪

459.1: The ninth Shiratsuyu-class Destroyer, Kawakaze of the revised Shiratsuyu-class. Nice to meet you!\nAh, about the reading of my name, do not get it wrong!

459.11: Hmm... I'll just take a short bath...
459.12: Oh well. Gonna take a long bath. You wanna join me, Admiral? Ha, kidding.

459.16: Hm, nice nice. Destroyers really belong to the battlefield. Let's go!
459.17: Alright, let's take 'em all at once!
459.18: Heheheh, Night battle ho! Let's plunge in, sissies! Follow me!
459.19: Puah... I still can go on! I ain't dying just yet!

459.20: Tch... What? Where did they hit me?!
459.21: Dammit... They got me... but I ain't sinking yet... owowowowow....
459.22: The hell... I'm in deep sea again... Big sis... everyone... let's meet... again..
459.23: Hm? I'm number one? Heh, Nothing personal, Shiratsuyu sis. Cause I'm numero uno! Hehehe.

459.25: Ninth ship of the Shiratsuyu-class, the revised Shiratsuyu-class destroyer, Kawakaze.\nWell now, I was built under the Maru 2 program, the same as Umikaze and our big sisters. Maaan, that was some hard, hard work! We sailed the Solomon's seas many times over. My last moments were during night battle. The enemy's radar... really, what foul play!
459.28: Whats up Admiral, tired? That's embarrassing. I guess I have no choice, you can lean on me. Nn? Here, hows that?
459.29: Ahhhh~ So bored. Hey Admiral, let's do something.　Or else my body will become quite weak.　Admiral, you listening?!
459.3: Revised Shiratsuyu-class. Top balance is good, don't you think?
459.30: Alright, Admiral, today's timekeeping role will be me, Kawakaze! Oh you can count on me! Gehehe!
459.31: It's 0100. Admiral, hehe, this is how it's done, right?
459.32: It's 0200, Admiral. Gehehe, easy peasy! Even timekeeping won't hold me back!
459.33: 03..0...0...  !! I'm not sleeping! Not sleepy at all! Because this is easy!
459.34: 0...4...zer-... !! Ah, big sis made me some morning tea! It's helpful! Now this will be a walk in a park!
459.35: 0...-ive...0...0...Admiral...while i'm doing this it's morning all sudden...Ahh, it's getting brighter...so this is morning huh, uhehe...sleepy...
459.36: Admiral,its 0600! It wakie time for everyone! Wake up-!! Sissies-!! It's Morning-!!
459.37: It's 0700! Admiral, let's eat breakfast! Breakfast! Uh, I can't do this, I'm not my sister. Now, let's go!
459.38: (munch) Admiral its 0800. The breakfast at Mamiya's is delicious!
459.39: It's 0900! Admiral, let's begin managing fleets. Where should I start... from expedition ? hmm...
459.4: The hell? Don't touch my equipment... Hm~? Admiral what's wrong? You're interested over me? Hm?
459.40: 100-eh, Solomon seas? Yeah, I've been there, quite a lot actually. Drum cans on my back transporting stuff and also patrol duty. Quite a chore.
459.41: It's 1100 now, Admiral. We talked too much that it's already noon. Say, you're hungry? Eh, we're having field rations for lunch?
459.42: It's 1200, Admiral! Lunchtime is Onigiri time. Whoop-pe-doodie-do. I'm good at making onigiri. Eat'em!
459.43: Admiral, It's 1300 now. How do you like my onigiri? Taste good, eh? Nothing beats like making em above water. That's what I think.
459.44: It's 1400, Admiral. Alrighty, It's time to get serious. Tokyo Express, eh. Now where's my drum?
459.45: Admiral! It's 1500! Where's the snack? Huh?! Nothing?! Why nothing?! My stomach's rumbling here!
459.46: Admiral, it's 1600 already. It's already dusk... Say, does that mean there's night battle tonight? Sendai's gonna be there, right?
459.47: It's 1700 now, Admiral. So how's dinner...? Huh, what? You're gonna cook? Yeah, Not a bad idea♪
459.48: Admiral! It's 1800! Whoa! Dinner's served! Down the hatch~! *nom* *nom* 'tis good, Admiral. Awesome!
459.49: Ahh— I've ate well... No wait, it's 1900, Admiral. So— I'm off with Sendai to a night battle~
459.5: So, a new one has arrived.
459.50: 2000. Gonna watch out for the enemy's radar detection. Sendai, let's proceed with caution!
459.51: 2100. Eh? Shigure, what's the matter? Ah? Numerous torpedoes?! Evaaadeee!
459.52: 2200. Admiral—! We've made it back safely from the night battle! Sendai and everyone else is alright. Phew!
459.53: Admiral, it's 2300, today was a tiring day huh, good work! Tomorrow we'll work at it too! Yeah!

459.7: Ahh~ Operation is over. Good work, good work!

459.9: Oh? Thank you. Yep~ that's nice.

459.Summer 6547: It's summertime?! Ku~ it's so damn hot!! What a shame! It'd a waste not to wear a swimsuit now, am I right? Admiral, you can strip down, too.

46.1: My name is Samidare! I look forward to\nworking with you. Please leave any escort\nmissions to me!

46.11: Fu... I'll take a small rest.
46.12: I can't anymore... I will take a small nap then...
46.13: At last it's finally our turn.

46.17: Please leave the front lines to me.
46.18: It's not over yet, it starts from here!

I'm Samidare. My friends Murasame,
Yuudachi and Harusame, we made up
DesDiv2. Oh yeah, during a transport
mission, I crashed into Shiratsuyu...

460.31: Admiral, it is 0100. Yes. Hayasui is still fine. Look!
460.32: Admiral, it is 0200. No, I'm not feeling sleepy! Yes!
460.33: 03...0...0... H-huh? I'm awake! I'm totally fine!
460.34: 0...4... Mmph... I can't load any more...
460.35: Mmph... mmph... Wah! Come on, Admiral! Why didn't you wake me up! No!
460.36: It is 0600. Admiral... Yes, I'm sorry. I will start preparing breakfast.
460.37: 0700, and the breakfast is ready. Please, help yourself. Today's menu is mugimeshi with potato miso soup, dried fish and...
460.38: Admiral, it is 0800. Yes! It might not be as good as Mamiya-san's, but I have a storage so I am quite good at cooking.
460.39: Admiral, it is 0900. Well, let's work hard today as well!
460.4: Admiral, my turntable is... um... well... it's nothing. I'm fine!
460.40: Admiral, it is 1000. We will start with status check on the expedition fleet. Hmmm...

460.48: Admiral, it is 1800. What should we do about dinner. What will be good? Hayasui, will prepare it.

460.51: Admiral, it is 2100. The third torpedo squadron seems to be lively. I wonder what's going on? Eh, don't worry about it? Ah, okay.
460.52: Admiral, it is 2200. Eh? Taiyou-san? Yes, I believe we'll meet here someday. For sure.
460.53: 2300. Admiral, good work today as well. Let's do our best tomorrow too! Yes!

460.9: This equipment is... Ah, yes! It is compatible with me!

461.18: Now... what's going to appear? Make sure you watch out for submarines.
461.19: O-ouch... I can still do this!

With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten over Mariana, I wish to continue taking a leap forward with the admiral.

461.41: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
