461.5: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
461.50: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
461.53: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?
461.6: Admiral, ship in the dock was fully repaired.
461.7: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
461.8: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
461.9: So this is the new model equipment... Ah, yes! I shall put it to good use.

462.1: The carrier whose rigging was completely modernized, Zuikaku here.\nDon't confuse me for your average aircraft carrier!
462.14: Task Force flagship Zuikaku, now setting sail! Follow my lead!

I fought until the very last arrow was fired... which was literally the day the Mobile Fleet was completely annihilated. ...However, this time will be different! I will show you the strength and potential of a fully remodeled aircraft carrier! Shoukaku-nee, let's do this!
462.9: New planes? That's great! Thank you!

463.1: Hi! I am the Iowa-class battleship, Iowa.\nYou're the admiral of this fleet? Hmm... not bad!\nThe pleasure is all mine!
463.13: Eighth Destroyer Division flagship Asashio, setting sail!
463.19: Ugh! Ow, ow, ow... Arashio...? Are you alright?
463.20: It hurts... but, even so... I can still assist in combat! I... won't sink so easily!
463.21: Not yet... I can't sink yet... not until I've upheld my promise. Not until then...
463.4: Commander... Sir! The promise... I'm prepared to uphold my important promise to you until the very end!

464.1: I am Kasumi, now a remodeled Asashio-class destroyer! Of course, we are charging forth. Come. Follow me.
464.12: Geez, what kind of order is this. It's really troublesome!
464.13: Kasumi, departing! I can't just stand by and watch.
464.14: Kasumi, interim flagship of the Second Torpedo Squadron, leaving port! Follow me!
464.17: Argh, no one but idiots! Action is all there is! Let's do it!
464.18: Argh, there's nobody else but idiots...
464.19: Kyaa! You've got to kidding me!

464.20: Hit!? Me!? You bastard! I'll get you!

464.23: It's not like I'm happy or any... No, that's not it. The will and pride of destroyer crews... It's rather nice. I'll take it.

464.4: Hah? Now you're angry at me for what you did? How undisciplined.

465.1: Mr. Admiral, thanks for the hard work.\nTraining cruiser, Kashima, checking in! Ufufu!

The time spent on my original duty wasn't long, but I gave my very best both as a fleet flagship and escort. After the battle ended, for the sake of the future, I worked very hard! Please don't forget about my services, okay?
465.28: Mr. Admiral. Someday, when the waters are peaceful again, I would like to go on a deep sea cruise with you! There are so many places that I want to see! Will we? We'll go for sure, right? I'm looking forward to it.
465.29: Mr. Admiral? Mr. Admiral! Umm... I want to talk about the escort fleet... O-Oh, you look busy... don't you? Excuse me. Later is fine with me... okay.
465.3: Oh, my. I'll be the Fourth Fleet's flagship, then? Not right now? Well, now...
465.4: This sensation... that's not big sis Katori, is it...? See! I knew it! Mr. Admiral! Fufu♪
465.5: Mr. Admiral, the new ship would like to introduce herself.
465.6547: Mr. Admiral, it's a pleasant fall, isn't it? I was also launched in fall, you know? Ufufu♪
465.8: Oh, do you want to see the stats? I'll get them for you, okay?

465.Summer 6547: It's almost summer. I wonder what Katori-nee will do about her swimsuit? I suppose I should get one as well? What should I do?

466.1: I'm Shoukaku, the first of the Shoukaku-class carriers.\nAlongside Zuikaku as a remodeled Shoukaku-class, I'm hoping to be a useful source of strength for the admiral.
466.10: I'm so happy! Many thanks, Admiral.
466.11: I'll take a short bath... be out in a bit.
466.12: I seem to get injured rather easily... right, Zuikaku?
466.13: New CarDiv 5, flagship Shoukaku, moving out!
466.14: You ready, Zuikaku? Don't fall behind. Mobile squad, setting sail!
466.16: Here I go. All planes, attack!
466.17: Support team, cover the assault squad!
466.18: My, it's another squall. Zuikaku, do you want to change the course a bit?
466.19: O-ouch... I can still do this!
466.2: A brand new and modified flight deck and equipment. This is the aviation design of a new era. I'll do my best!
466.20: Ah! Ouch! A-are we still able to takeoff?
466.21: The remodeled Shoukaku-class, will not sink with just this. ...Is the flight deck alright? ...Hm? ...Thank goodness. I can still fight on!
466.22: Looks like... I'm gone again... Yahagi, Akizuki... please take care of things now.
466.23: I did it, Admiral! It's all thanks to the planes and supporting ships! Thank you all!
466.24: Thank you, Admiral. Giving me these planes that I've never seen before, my gratitude is overflowing. Maybe… just maybe… if my wish comes true, after the Marianas, we can stay together…
466.25: I'm Shoukaku, the first ship in the Shoukaku carrier series.\nI was designed and built as the first purpose-built large regular carrier to serve after the Washington Treaty was renounced. With my sister Zuikaku, we make the fifth carrier division. Following the tragedy, we followed in the footsteps of our seniors and continued to support the front lines. And now, having gotten over Mariana, I wish to continue taking a leap forward with the admiral.
466.28: Admiral... Had I, been of help to you? Fufu... I see... so that's how it is. I'm glad... I'm so glad!
466.29: Admiral? Um... We should head to Port Moresby... Um, uh...
466.3: Zuikaku, don't give our supporting ship a hard time, okay? Zuikaku...? Zuikaku!?
466.30: Admiral? Seems like the date has changed.
466.35: It's now 0500. The sun's about to come up, huh.
466.36: 0600. It's about wake-up time for everyone.
466.37: 0700. What would you like for breakfast?
466.38: 0800. I'll do my best today too.
466.39: It's now 0900. Should I send out scout planes?
466.4: Geez, Zuikaku, stop fiddling with my skirt so mu- huh, oh my, Admiral?
466.40: It's 1000. I wonder if Zuikaku is okay?
466.41: 1100. I guess we should prepare for lunch.
466.42: Admiral, it's 1200. Shall we have lunch?
466.44: It's 1400. Admiral, are you feeling tired?
466.45: It's 1500. The campaign is about to begin.
466.46: 1600. I'll be sending up the CAP.
466.47: It's 1700. Isn't the sunset beautiful, Admiral?
466.5: Admiral, a new ship has been completed.
466.50: 2000. There are some noisy light cruisers. I wonder why?
466.53: It's now 2300. You really should be resting now shouldn't you?
466.6: Admiral, ship in the dock was fully repaired.
466.7: The fleet has returned! Thank you all for the hard work.
466.8: Admiral, would you like to browse through the report?
466.9: So this is the new model equipment... Ah, yes! I shall put it to good use.

467.16: Now, let's get started. This time we'll definitely strike from outside their range. All strike squadrons, take off!
467.21: Damn! That hit came out of nowhere! Suppress any explosions! Is the deck intact? Then I can still fight!

47.10: Thank you, it'll be perfect with this.
47.12: Ugh... even though I can still...still go on...

47.14: Yeah, I've been waiting for this!
47.18: Ei! Take this with you, thief!
47.23: I did it! Admiral, did you see my performance?
47.24: Emmm. I… the A...admira… li... Ugh. ...Nothing....You're wrong! I said nothing!
47.25:
I'm Suzukaze. As a Special-class
destroyer, I participated in lots
of capture missions. After that, I escorted
battleships and carriers!
You can rely on me! I'll fight until the last!
47.27: Yes! I can go on with this!
47.29: Heey, Admiraal! What's wrongg!? You're ignoring me too muuch!?Heey, did you hear thaat? Aadmirraal!?

47.7: Operation completed, fu... want to take a break?
47.9: Ok, I can go on with this!

470.14: Kasumi, interim flagship of the Second Torpedo Squadron, leaving port! Follow me!
470.17: Argh, no one but idiots! Action is all there is! Let's do it!
470.18: Argh, there's nobody else but idiots...
470.19: Kyaa! You've got to kidding me!
470.2: If you need me for something, look at me in the eyes!
470.20: Hit!? Me!? You bastard! I'll get you!
470.21: I won't sink from something like this! It's no joke, I tell you!
470.22: To think that I would sink... I won't... I won't accept this...!
470.23: It's not like I'm happy or any... No, that's not it. The will and pride of destroyer crews... It's rather nice. I'll take it.
470.24: Oh, for the garbage commander to be in a place like this, you must be quite free huh... eh... present? For me? Eh... Ah... you idiot...
470.25: I fought intensely as a main fleet destroyer in history. In the end, I fought alongside battleship Yamato in Operation Ten-go against the fierce attacks of American carrier-based aircraft. I won't lose!
470.27: What is it, resupply!? ...Well, it's necessary though.
470.28: W-what? I'm actually grateful to you a little, if you weren't here I'd be lonely… D-don't get the wrong idea!

471.1: I've kept you waiting, Commander. First ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers, Kamikaze, has arrived. Are you ready, everyone? Follow me.
471.10: Mm, this is good. I can survive till the very end with this. Thank you.
471.11: Just a little... let me rest a little. No peeking. I'll be done in an instant.
471.12: Ahh... this is awful in many ways. Commander, I'm taking a break for a while. Hurm...
471.13: Destroyer Division 1 Flagship, Kamikaze. It's time to weigh anchor!
471.14: Flagship Kamikaze, setting sail. Are you ready, everyone? Follow me.
471.15: Enemy fleet spotted. Right, ready for battle. On me, everyone.
471.18: Pursuing the enemy fleet. Battle speed 5. Charge! Follow me!
471.2: Commander, did you call me? I am prepared.
471.21: I'm hit? Where? I-I won't sink!
471.22: No way. It can't be! I'm filling with water... No...
471.23: Yes! Ah, but please don't praise me. I'm only doing my usual routine. T-that's right.
471.24: Yes, Commander? Another escort mission? I don't mind that... Eh, no? What is that on your hand? It's... for me? Wow, really? Thank you. I'll treasure it... I will treasure it for sure!
471.25: I am the first of the Kamikaze-class Destroyers, Kamikaze. I am the nameship of a fleet of destroyers designed during the Eight-Eight Fleet Program era. We may be an older model compared to the Mutsuki-class, but I managed to run through that battle to the very end. I hope you'll remember who we are.
471.27: Right. Refueling complete! What's next? Fleet escort?
471.28: Commander, you look tired. Okay, I'll pour something warm for you to drink. One moment, please. Here you go. So, are you warming up? Really? That's a relief.
471.29: Destroyer-1? Ah, I was once called that a long time ago. But I am now Kamikaze! That's my nameship! Be sure to remember it!
471.3: I'm an old type? Silly you. A destroyer's capabilities aren't about her specs.
471.4: Stop it, Harukaze. I'm not fond of such things... eh? It's you, Commander. What's the meaning of this? I desire an explanation.
471.5: New ship construction has completed. Good!
471.6547: Commander, it's autumn! This time of year makes me feel so excited! Commander, how does autumn make you feel?
471.7: Commander, the fleet has returned. In any case, I'm glad that they're all okay.
471.8: Looking at intel? It is vital. I'm glad that you're an able Commander.
471.9: Am I getting stronger? Th-Thank you. I'm glad, but...
471.Rainy 6547: Miss Haguro, please be careful at this time of year! Ah, you too, Miss Ashigara! If you're heading somewhere, I'll accompany you.

473.1: My name is Harukaze, third ship of the Kamikaze class of destroyers. Commander-sama, I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
473.10: This is... really great equipment! I'm really happy.
473.11: Commander-sama, I am going to freshen up. Please wait a bit.
473.12: Commander-sama, I am so sorry. I'm going to heal my injuries.
473.13: Harukaze of the Fifth Destroyer Corps. Thank you for the privilege of sortieing. Setting sail.

473.15: What do I do... enemy ships have been spotted. Everyone, please get ready.
473.17: Oh, my. The enemy is still here as well.
473.18: It has come to a night battle. Everyone, please continue to follow me.

473.23: I am...? Really? Thank you, I'm glad to be here. I am delighted.
473.24: Commander-sama, you called for the fifth destroyer group? Eh? Only me? Ah, yes. This is for me!? Thank you very much. I will cherish it.
473.25: I am Harukaze, the third ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers. I was born in Maizuru. I used to be called Destroyer-5, but I later got a real name, "Harukaze". I was in Destroyer Division 5 and also belonged to the first Maritime Escort Flotilla, in which I helped protect everyone. Even if the fighting ends... I will still protect you.
473.27: Refueling. I confirm that I have received it.
473.28: Commander-sama, do you want to hear about my dream? I was injured and then... Commander-sama? Did you fall asleep?
473.29: I wonder what is Asakaze doing now. If it's her, she's probably frolicking around, Commander-sama. Hm? Commander-sama? You look tired. Wait, I'll give you a blanket. Good night.
473.3: Hm? Oh? Commander-sama, thank you for today.
473.4: Commander-sama, is there something wrong with my rig? Ah, there was a flower petal? Ufufu, it's elegant on me.
473.5: I should go and meet the new ship.
473.6547: Commander-sama? Autumn is a time of delicious food. If I may, I would like to show you my skill and prepare you some delicious food, okay? Ufufufu.
473.7: Commander-sama, I'm here to report in. The fleet has returned to base.
473.8: You want to look at the report, right? I will bring it to you.
473.9: This is for me? You have my thanks, Commander-sama.
473.Rainy 6547: Rain... I'm well aware that not many are fond of the rainy season, but I love it. It fits well with my umbrella. I adore it so much. Don't you agree?

476.1: Commander, I'll do my best! First ship of the Kamikaze-class destroyers, Kamikaze, has arrived. Let's face our battles head-on!
476.10: Huh? It's for a transport mission? I guess. Actually, I'd rather not remove my torpedoes...
476.14: Even if the war outlook is bad, we've got to do something! Flagship Kamikaze, setting sail. Fleet, weigh anchor!
476.30: Right! Today I'll be taking care of you as your secretary. Is that ok? It is now 12 midnight. Leave the hourly announcements to me!
476.31: 0100. *yawn* I'm a bit sleepy... but I'll be fine. You can rely on me.
476.32: 0200. It's the hour of Ushimitsu. What? You're scared, Commander? Guess you do have an adorable side.
476.33: 0300. Umm... do you feel like... going to the washroom? I'll accompany you there. How's that...?
476.34: 0400. Oh, thank goodness. It's going to be morning. Eh? The night? I don't... find it... scary...
476.35: 0500. That's not it! I'm completely fine on the ocean. It's not the same as night time on dry land. Geez...
476.36: 0600. Commander, I'll be performing the morning call. Fleet, arise! It's morning. The morning has arrived. Rise and shine, everyone!
476.37: 0700. Right! Commander, allow me to cook. Wait a moment, please... Okay! Sorry to keep you waiting. I had to watch the barley rice.
476.38: 0800. What do you think of my cooking? Mmm! Right! So, after this, let's begin on with fleet operations.
476.39: 0900. What shall we start with this morning? Expeditions? Quests? Mmm, I can't decide with such a wonderful fleet. Commander, what do you think?
476.4: Is that Ashigara? I'm a bit busy right now... Eh? Commander!? What's the meaning of this? I would like an explanation of what it is you think you're doing.
476.40: 1000. Right! Now then, we should begin with an expedition. Put me in charge of a convoy escort. Hey! I can say with confidence that I won't return with less than one shou's worth.
476.41: 1100. Geez, it's almost lunch time... what should I do? I don't mind cooking again, but... how about cooking together? It can be the commander's solemn duty, mmm?
476.42: 1200. Okay, I've decided. We'll have salted rice balls for lunch...is that ok? I'll prepare some miso soup to go with it. It matches with the salty flavor.
476.43: 1300. How was it? Lunch, I mean. There's a shortage of vegetables. Fresh vegetables have gotten so expensive.
476.44: 1400. Didn't my salted rice balls turn out well? What? Did it take long to make....? ...Ah, no, not at all! I am very efficient cook.
476.45: 150— Ah, Haguro! Thank you for your hard work. You look great... eh... ah... Well, I'm feeling great too. Look, look! I'm fine!
476.46: 1600. A transport operation? Right, then. Though I do feel a little worried without torpedoes... I'll be fine, so don't worry!
476.47: 1700. Ah, Commander, the sun is setting. How beautiful... this reminds me of the sunset I saw in Singapore. It's nostalgic. Is Nokaze....all right?
476.48: 1800. Commander, it's past sunset, isn't it? The fleet has returned to port? Let me cook dinner, then. Please look forward to it.
476.49: 1900... Here, Commander! Kamikaze special pork miso soup with fresh vegetables. It'll go well with the barley rice. Bon appetite!
476.50: 20— Oh?! Ashigara? Mmm, mmm... You are preparing pork cutlet curry rice here? Wow, that's wonderful... Commander, can you eat? Ah, you ate it. That's great.
476.51: 2100. Mmmmmm... delicious. Ashigara, thank you for the victory pork cutlet curry rice. *sigh* I overate.
476.52: 2200. Eh... Commander, what is it? What makes me feel afraid? Mmm...submarines are a nightmare for a convoy escort, you know? Eh, you don't believe me?
476.53: 2300. I can't do it! Submarines are terrifying. Of course, any enemy is horrible... Night time? The sea at night is not so frightening.
476.9: You're going to make me stronger? Thanks. Don't forget the anti-sub equipment!

48.1: Arare... I won't say 'ncha-'...\nLook after me...
48.16: It's not just guns, but torpedoes...?
48.2: Commander..... is there something, to do?
48.22: Ah... water is getting in... it's cold...
48.23: Eh...? What's this standing ovation...? Did Arare do something...?
48.24: Ah… Commander, what is it? I want to get back to work.. Yeah…
48.25:
Arare, the last destroyer constructed
under the Maru-2 programme...
Asashio-class series'... final ship but...
there's more... After that... Kagero-class...
48.29: Commander... Things to do... No, it's all good...
48.4: Please don't touch my torpedoes that much...
48.6: A boat has been fully repaired.
48.6547: So fall has arrived. Yeah... the fall insects are... making noises... aren't they....
48.Rainy 6547: Rainy season... rain... rain sounds... I don't hate... them.
48.Summer 6547: Ahh... it's a bit... hot... It's almost summer... Admiral... ah... it's... it's nothing.

481.1: Sixth ship of the Mutsuki-class destroyers, Minazuki here. Sorry I'm late. Commander, take care! ...Ehehe.
481.10: Ohhhh... I get it now. So it's like this.
481.11: Sorry. I'll take a quick bath. Commander... no peeking, okay? Er... he left.
481.12: Ahhh... sorry. This is a little bad, huh? I'll go get cleaned up. Please wait. Whew...

481.15: The enemy... I've spotted them. No helping it... let's go! Alright, everyone?

481.17: Even against submarines or surface ships... this time... I won't lose!
481.18: Time for pursuit, huh? I understand. Let's do it. Fleet, form up! I will lead the assault!
481.2: Oh? Did you call me? It's fine.
481.20: That hurts...! Ugh... I'm getting ticked off!
481.21: Owowow... What's up with that? This is the worst! I-I can still move! I won't sink!
481.22: Eh...? I'm sinking...? No way... Sacchin... Fumi-chan... sorry...
481.23: Ehehehe! I was the biggest help? Yeah! Go me! Mutsuki-class power! Go ahead and praise me more! Fufu♪
481.24: Commander, what is it? You called? Oh, okay. ...What's going on? Ehehe... what's that thing you're hiding? Nice, nice, what is it, what is it? Ah, this? Can I open it? Then... I'll open it. Whoa...! Is this seriously...? Fufu... whooaah♪
481.25: I'm the sixth ship of the Mutsuki class, Minazuki. I was born in Uraga near Yokosuka. Along with my older and younger Mutsuki-class sisters, I participated in battles at the start of the war. I also served as a convoy escort a bunch of times. Oh? Submarines...? They're really annoying enemies. *sigh* Don't I know it.
481.28: What's wrong? You're looking pretty worn out. Commander, you don't look so good. Ehe... Alright! I'll cheer you right up. Ehehe♪ How's this! Eh? It didn't work? Alright! It's time to get serious...!
481.29: Heeey. Hey, heyheyhey, heee~ey! Huh? Commander, can't you hear me...? He looks so busy. No helping it... I'll go over to Sacchin's, then. Okay~ off I go.
481.3: Sacchin...? ...Ah, my bad. Nah, it's nothing. Ehehehe...
481.4: Commander, what's wrong? Are you getting hungry? No helping it... want me to go make you something? It's fine.
481.5: Commander, it's a new ship! I'm so happy!
481.6547: Fall has arrived. Commander, what does fall mean to you? ...For Sacchin, fall is for food. For Fumi-chan, fall is for reading. For Naganaga, fall is for sports, I think. What about you, Commander? Maybe fall is... the season of love?
481.7: Commander, the fleet's back! Everyone is safe. That's the most important thing.
481.8: Oh, okay. The intelligence, huh? I'll bring it right away! Wait right here. ... ...Here.
481.9: This is great. I'm happy... Ehehehe♪

483.1: Hey, hey, hey! So you're the admiral! I'm the submarine, I-26, but you can call me Nimu! Nice to meet you!
483.10: Hey, hey, hey, listen! This armament? It looks great! Yay!
483.12: Sorry! I'm gonna take a long bath.
483.14: Flagship of the submarine squadron, I-26 Nimu. Setting sail!
483.15: Enemy ship spotted! Periscope depth... torpedoes armed... ready!
483.18: I-26, commencing pursuit of enemy remnants. You-won't-get-away!
483.19: Kyaaa...! Not good! Dive! Hurry up and dive!
483.2: Hmm? Did you call for me?
483.20: N-Nooooo! Water is... this is bad!
483.21: Th-They got me...! Emergency blow! I'm not finished yet! Preparing for surface shelling!
483.22: Th-They got me! Emergency blow! To the surface! ...Huh? I'm not rising...? I'm going to sink...? No way... no way...
483.23: Eh? No way... I got the best results this time? I did it! Okay! What big fish should I eat next? Maybe an aircraft carrier? Admiral, look forward to it!
483.24: Admiral, what, what, what? You wanted me? ...Hm? What? That box and that face... Eh? Could it be? Could it be? Could it really be?! Hey, hey, hey! ...So it is! Thank you. I'm happy!
483.25: I'm an I-class from Kure! Hey, hey, hey, I just remembered something about me! Of course commerce raiding is my specialty, but I can also eat up heavy cruisers and aircraft carriers! Leave it to me!
483.26: It's here, it's here, it's here!
483.28: *whew* Today is all work, work! Hmm? Oh, oh? What's wrong, Admiral? What, what, what? You don't look so good. Okay! You can use my lap as a pillow and rest. Yup! Come, come, come!
483.29: Torpedoes loaded, fuel okaaay. Potatoes and onions, loaded up, loaded uuuup. Okay! Now I'll be ready when it's my turn!
483.3: What, what, what? My turn? ...A commerce raid op? Leave it to me, Admiral!
483.4: Eh? It's not Nina— it's Nimu. Admiral, make sure you remember my name properly, okay? Because I'm pretty good!
483.5: Hey, hey, hey! It's a new girl, you know?
483.6547: Awww... summer is over. It's fall. This season is... ummmm... Ah, Fusou-san? Eh? Breakthrough training? Ah... ummmm... errr....
483.7: *whew* We came back! Everyone worked hard, and I worked hard, too!
483.8: What, what? You want to look over the intelligence? Okay.
483.9: Ah, this equipment is good. Thanks!

486.1: I'm the youngest of the Special Type I Fubuki-class destroyers, Uranami. Commander, I'm looking forward to working with you.
486.11: Excuse me... I'll go enter into maintenance.
486.12: Commander, please excuse me. I'll be going in for some repairs.
486.13: Fubuki-class destroyer Uranami, now setting sail!
486.15: Enemy fleet spotted! Artillery, torpedoes, reeeaaaady! Let's go!
486.17: Isonami nee-san... I will also do my best!
486.18: Fleet, please enter into formation. Starting the assault!
486.20: Stop it... I said stop it...!
486.21: Gwaaaaah...!! I was hit? Where? From above? J-Jettison anything flammable!
486.22: It looks... like this is as far as I go. Isonami nee-san, Ayanami, Shikinami... ...everyone, where are you?
486.23: Eh? My battle results were... such a thing is... ...No. I feel honored to receive such praise!

486.25: The tenth ship of the Special Revised I Type Fubuki-class destroyers, Uranami here. I was born in Sasebo. I formed the 19th Destroyer Division together with Isonami nee-san, Ayanami, and Shikinami. I deployed to Midway at the beginning of the war, and even went to the southern seas. Please remember the 19th Destroyer Division's services.
486.27: Aye! I can join the next operation immediately!
486.28: Commander, are you feeling thirsty? So I see... I know! Isonami nee-san gave me some delicious teacakes. I'll go pour some Hojicha.
486.29: U-Um... Commander, you look so busy. I don't want to get in the way of your work. I know! I'll go see how Ayanami and Shikinami are doing. I'll bring some teacakes for us to have.
486.3: Aye! Special Revised Type I, Uranami here.
486.4: Ah, right there? Yes, my engine intake port is the same as Ayanami's and the others'. So you noticed.
486.5: Commander! A brand new ship is being commissioned!
486.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned!
486.8: The intelligence? Please wait a moment. I'll go get it.

49.12: Geez, what kind of order is this. It's really troublesome!
49.13: Kasumi, departing! I can't just stand by and watch.
49.17: It would be great if you would just die!
49.18: Argh, there's nobody else but idiots...

The last completed heavy cruiser of the
Japanese Navy, oldest sister of the
Tone-class, Tone. At Pearl Harbor
and Midway, as the eye for the fleet,
I unceasingly watched the length and
breadth of the ocean. I ended out the
war protecting the Kure Naval Yards as
a floating fortress, fighting until my blades
were broken, arrows were depleted.

watching the sky over Etajima village's

and from there referring to her name,

accident? Well, can't cover it up

82.17: Main cannon, 4 rounds 8 shots, broadside fire!

82.23: Eh, I've still got the number one result? How about that Hyuuga, you're being a bit quiet.

82.25:
To obtain the power of marine aviation,
a main cannon was removed, and in it's
place, a flight deck was installed, granting
the aviation power of a light aircraft carrier.
Aviation battleship, Ise. My name was
taken up by the newly-developed DDH
of the Marine Self Defense Force.
82.27: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?
82.3: Well, seaplanes are just the standard, you know.
82.4: The firepower of a battleship with the flight power of a light aircraft carrier... yeah, it's pretty awesome, isn't it?
82.5: Admiral, looks like a new ship type has been launched.
82.6: Admiral, seem like repairs are finished.
82.7: The armada has returned. Good work!
82.8: Letter for the admiral.. you are probably busy, yeah?
82.9: Hehe, Hyuuga's in for a surprise, isn't she?

83.1: I'm the aircraft carrier Akagi. If you're\nforming a carrier division, just leave it\nto me.
83.10: Thank you very much for the modernization.
83.11: I'll be preparing for the next operation.
83.12: Looks like it'll take a little while to repair the flight deck.
83.13: We mustn't be overconfident. Let's move forward with all our might!
83.15: First strike squadron, please take off!
83.17: All carrier-based planes, are you ready?
83.18: Second strike squadron, all planes, take off!
83.2: Are we holding a strategy meeting?

83.22: I'm so sorry... scuttle me... please do it...
83.23: We must not become complacent following this victory. Reconnaissance and gaining the initiative are key... wait... where did that come from?
83.24: Admiral... Admiral, when I'm with you, I feel as though there is a way to change those fateful five minutes. I will do my best.
83.25:
I'm the aircraft carrier, Akagi. As part
of the core of the Mobile Strike Force,
I support the victorious advances.
Together with my pride experienced
planes, we were called the invincible fleet.
Overconfident, you say...?
Hmm, perhaps so... I'll keep that in mind.
83.27: Thank you very much for resupplying my planes. It helps a lot.
83.28: 1st CarDiv, Akagi, always ready to deploy! Admiral, please take a break sometimes.
83.29: Um... Admiral? Is it mealti- no! Is it time to start the strategy meeting yet?!
83.3: Reppuu? No, never heard of it.
83.4: Ryuusei? Is that different from the Type 97 Torpedo Bomber?
83.5: A new ship can now take part in the task force.

83.8: Admiral, I have a message for you.
83.9: I guess having three flight decks... is unnecessary, huh?

83.Summer 6547: Oh my, Kaga-san. Summer is coming. Eh? A new swimsuit? I hadn't thought about getting one...

84.1: I'm aircraft carrier, Kaga. Are you my\nAdmiral?... I have fairly high expectations\nof you.
84.10: This is great equipment. I find it very uplifting.
84.12: It will take some time to repair this damage. I apologize.
84.13: I will not give this up.
84.15: Don't associate me with the Fifth Division's children.
84.16: It will end in one strike, so do not worry.
84.18: All of my children are exceptional.
84.19: I won't have this hanging over my head.
84.2: Is there... something on my face?
84.20: My deck is on fire... this can't...
84.21: A direct hit on the flight deck. That's... impossible...

I, Kaga, was built as the third ship of the
eight-eight fleet. After being played by fate,
time after time, I was completed as
a large aircraft carrier. Along with
Akagi-san, we are main force of the
glorious first air carrier division.
84.28: Well... I feel the same way.
84.3: Do you need to consult with me? It's fine.

84.6: A ship has completed its repairs.
84.7: Operation completed. The fleet has returned.
84.8: There is a message here from Fleet Command.
84.9: I agree. This enhancement was a great decision.

84.Summer 6547: I am not too fond of the summer. The sea? Have fun.

85.1: Is the microphone's volume good?\nCheck, 1,2... Okay. Nice to meet you,\nI'm Kirishima.
85.10: This remodel is beyond what I had estimated. That's my commander! It far exceeds the previous data!
85.11: "Hope for the best and prepare for the worst," they say.
85.12: This is the best timing for entering the dock. As expected of you!
85.13: Sortieing! Now then, how shall we approach this?
85.15: Now, proceed with the exchange of fire!
85.16: Main battery, zero in on the enemy! ...Fire!

85.18: As for speed and firepower... fufu♪ Commencing night battle!
85.21: How did...? My combat analysis was...
85.22: The sea floor is... surprisingly warm... ... ...
85.23: I'll give my all to be known as the genius of the fleet!
85.24: If my predictions hold true, after the battle is over, I believe the commander and I will... most likely... most likely...! ...No, it was nothing!
85.25:
Kirishima here. I won't lose to my
sister ship Haruna's brains! As a
domestically-produced fast battleship,
I'll work hard! One of the Aegis ships
of the modern JMSDF succeeds my name.
85.27: With this enhancement, my battle strength has risen appreciably as a result. You have my thanks.
85.28: Your judgment is impeccable, as always.
85.3: Come now, deliver your orders promptly, Commander.
85.4: That is... for what reason are you poking me so often? Is this some new form of command?
85.5: There's a notification about a new ship.

85.9: With this enhancement, my battle strength has risen appreciably as a result! You have my thanks.

86.1: I'm Hiei, Kongou Onee-sama's sister.\nI'm looking forward to gaining experience\nand getting closer to my sister's brilliance.
86.10: I wonder if I got closer to Onee-sama?
86.11: These injuries, are just scratches though...
86.12: While dreaming of Onee-sama, I'll rest.
86.13: Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!
86.14: I won't lose to Commander, in love or in battle!
86.17: I, will do my best, so don't abandon me!
86.18: I will not forgive anyone who gets in the way of Onee-sama!
86.2: Ah, yes. Did you call for me?
86.21: To do such things to the equipment handed over from Onee-sama... I-I can't forgive this!
86.22: Is Kongou Onee-sama... safe? Then, it's... alright...
86.23: Did you see me in action? Right! Then, giving my best was worth it!
86.24: Thank you for your favour, Commander... B-but... my heart... belongs to oneesama! Eh? It's not that kind of talk!? O-oh.. I see... I-I'm so embarrassed~!
86.25:
The battlecruiser that Admiral Inoue loved,
it's Hiei. Even though I'm a shiny Imperial
ship, I'll work my hardest. I was even the
test-ship for the Yamato class, didn't you
know? Eh? The Battle of Guadalcanal?
Yes, I fought hard.
86.27: Yeah, my strength is surging up!
86.28: Hiei can still fight some more. Commander, let's do our best together!
86.29: Oh yeah! I'm feelin' psyched! ...or so I felt? huh what?... whattt...?

86.31: It's 1 A.M... Hiei is fast asleep.
86.33: 3 A.M. Now I am getting wide awake.
86.34: 4 A.M. Can't sleep, why can't I sleep! This is your fault, you know!
86.35: 5 A.M. Hie~i! This turned out to be pretty much an all-nighter!
86.36: 6 A.M. I'm all swollen... I can't let Onee-sama see my face like thiiiis!
86.37: 7 A.M. Hmmm... I didn't get enough sleep, you know~ Off I go! With all my spirit! Held high!
86.38: 8 A.M. Battleships have such a lot of maintenance to do in the morning, it's quite a strain, you know!
86.39: 9 A.M. Yeah! The prep work will be always be ready now!
86.4: Unnnngh... Ah..!! What is it? I wasn't sleeping! I swear I wasn't!
86.40: 10 A.M. I'm gonna watch TV while on standby, 'ka~y?
86.41: 11 A.M. Chief? What's this 'Wife and Mother-in-law' problem?
86.42: 12 midday~ I've taken a liking to this midday program~ Eh? You'll take me to the recording? I'm fired up now!
86.43: It's 13 o'clock. Whew~ Lunch breaks sure are fun~
86.44: It's 14 o'clock now. H-huh? Oh no, we forgot to eat lunch! Wha-what should we do?
86.45: 15 o'clock. Ah Commander, that store over there is still doing lunch.
86.46: 16 o'clock. Ah, today I got to enjoy an outing with the commander. Eh? That's a bad thing?
86.47: The day's gotten dark~ It's 17 o'clock. I'm glad the base was quiet today, Commander.
86.49: 19 o'clock. Done~! My famous recipe—Hiei Curry! Go on, eat it up!

86.50: 20 o'clock. How is it? Your impression of Hiei's curry? Your impressions...I wanna hear your impressions!

86.52: It's now 22 o'clock. *gloom* Looks like the commander got away...
86.53: 23 o'clock. Oh well, I guess I'll go to Onee-sama's room... Onee-... Commander! Why are you here?!

86.8: Seems like there's a notice for the admiral.
86.9: Yes! I can feel the power surging!
86.Anniversary 6547: I, Hiei, on the third year of love, will go! With my spirits... Held high! Yeah! *pant*

87.1: You're the Admiral? I see. Anyway. Second\nship of the Ise class, Hyuuga. Remember\nme, if you would.
87.11: I like to rest when we can.
87.12: Well, I'll leave the front line to Ise.

87.17: Why is the enemy fleet attacking us...?
87.18: Well, might as well bring it down now...
87.2: Hey... aren't you... Oh, it's you, Admiral.
87.20: Hey hey...! Why the fifth turret?
87.21: Well... A little bit breezy thanks to that... I guess...

2nd of the Ise-class battleships, Hyuuga.
Ah yes, I became an aviation battleship
together with Ise you know. That's
originally because an accident
happened on my 5th turret.
I'm fighting 'til I am sunk at Kure.

87.7: The fleet is back. Things will get busy...

87.Summer 6547: I don't have a problem with this season. Ise... Ise? Ah, are you sleeping?

88.18: You're a problem... We'll have to wipe you out here!
88.2: Oh... It's you. You're still here.
88.21: Ugh... I wouldn't want Ise to see me like this

88.24: Aviation Battleship... got a nice ring to it, yeah? You get it, right? Alright... let's drink! We're not going back 'till morning!

I'm Hyuuga. I got the ability of carrying
aircrafts, and now I am an aviation
battleship. I fought bravely in Battle of
Leyte Gulf.An operation of transporting
tactical goods "Operation Hoku-Go",
it is one with a lot of memories for me.
Ah yes, JMSDF's DDH "Hyuuga"
succeeds to my name.
88.27: The unlikely age of the aviation battleship, is it?

88.5: A new face is coming to our fleet... Let's go welcome her.
88.6: The repairs seem to be finished.
88.7: The fleet's returned. Let's hope they're all present and well...
88.8: Here's a letter for you... No, not from me.
88.9: The unlikely age of the aviation battleship, is it?

89.11: In that case, I'll have a little rest.
89.12: I shouldn't have acted so recklessly.
89.13: Live combat...? I suppose it can't be helped.
89.15: Wind direction... check! Air force, take off!
89.16: This is... not an exercise. It's live combat!
89.17: We can't just keep doing exercises forever!
89.18: When you do something... you do it well!
89.21: I have no intention of sinking like this...!
89.22: Even I... can sink, it seems...
89.23: That's... is that true? To have been of some help to you... that's wonderful!
89.24: Someday... someday, just the two of us... I would like to enjoy a nice, relaxing cruise with you, okay?
89.25:
I am aircraft carrier Houshou. Built as CV
from the beginning, I'm the world's first
aircraft carrier. I am a petite ship,
but I'll do my best.
89.27: I'm so sorry. For you to be reinforcing my armament is...
89.28: Admiral, thanks as always for the hard work. When you can, please be sure to relax a little.
89.4: You must be tired. Shall I prepare the bath? Or perhaps dinner? Or perhaps... fufu! Just kidding.
89.5: It looks like new children are on the way!
89.6547: It's been a little cooler recently. It must be autumn.
89.7: Thanks for the hard work. The fleet has made its return.
89.8: Admiral, a message for you has arrived.
89.9: I'm so sorry. For you to be reinforcing my armament is...

9.1: Nice to meet you, I'm Fubuki.\nThanks for having me today as well.
9.10: For the commander, I'll do my best!
9.11: I'll be resting for a bit.
9.13: I'll be the one to finish them off!
9.2: Thanks for the hard work, Commander!
9.23: I was able to do it! It's all thanks to the commander!
9.24: Umm... hey... I... Commander, I mean... I l-l-lo... n-no... I have total faith in you! Sir!
9.25:
I am Fubuki, the first ship of the Special
Type destroyers designed under the
Washington Naval Treaty. We were superior
to existing ship classifications and shocked
the world. Based on our design, many
following fleet-type destroyers were built.
Yes sir, I'll do my best!
9.27: Thank you very much. I'll try even harder!
9.3: What would you like me to do next?
9.5: Ah! Didn't a new friend just arrive?
9.6: Commander. a ship has finished docking!
9.6547: Special Type Destroyer, first ship of the Fubuki-class, Fubuki! I'm going, Commander! Please watch over me!
9.7: Looks like the operation is complete.
9.9: Thank you very much! I'll try even harder!

9.Summer 6547: Gather up, Special Type Destroyers! We're starting our summer training! Pair up. Ah... oh, right! You'll pair with me! Okay?

90.1: I'm aircraft carrier Souryuu. If you're making\na carrier task force, count me in!
90.10: I'm so happy. Now I'm totally battle-ready.

90.13: My task fleet is now launching!
90.14: The aircraft are trained to perfection. I'm anticipating great results!
90.16: Watch the anti-air defense closely. I'm counting on you!
90.17: That's right— keep aiming for the big ones!
90.18: Keep the counterstrike going. All aircraft, take off!
90.19: Stop it, stop it, stop it!
90.20: The flight deck is getting bombed? Not good— it's going to blow...!

Aircraft carrier Souryuu. Starting from the
Pearl Harbor attack, an important battle of
the war, I became the flagship. Huh?
Midway? What's that? Is it tasty?
90.27: Supplies are critical. Thank you! *whew* With this, I can fight again!

90.9: Thanks. With this, I won't lose to Hiryuu!

91.1: I'm aircraft carrier Hiryuu. Leave the carrier\nbattles to me, I can fight on against any and\nall adversity.
91.10: Alright! With this, CarDiv 1 is no match for us!
91.11: I'll go do some quick repairs on my flight deck.
91.12: Good grief. Well, sometimes there's nothing you can do but enter the dock.
91.14: We'll win decisively! Be sure to scout thoroughly.
91.16: A second attack wave is required. Hurry!
91.17: Even if I'm the last ship standing, I'll give them hell!
91.18: Alright! Tomonaga Squadron, I'm counting on you!
91.19: This is nothing but a scratch!
91.2: Hm? Has an enemy carrier appeared?
91.20: Ouch! Are we... still able to land and take off?
91.22: So I'm going to sink... then I'll have one final little drink with the moon...
91.23: How's that! Hey, Tamon-maru, were you watching?
91.24: Sometimes... once in a while... it's okay to forget about the fighting, you know? Hey... look at me. Yeah! I love it... that smile...

Hiryuu-class aircraft carrier, Hiryuu.
Huh? Am I not an improved version
of the Souryuu-class, you say? Don't worry
about the details. More importantly,
scouting is paramount. In carrier warfare,
the first to strike wins! Don't let pride
blind you. Let's carefully, and also
boldly, fight on through!

91.4: Tamon-maru is going to get mad, you know?

91.8: The Red Brick has a message for you, it seems.
91.9: Great! I can continue fighting with this!

92.10: S-so cool! I'm gonna fall in love with myself~!
92.11: It's nothin' major. Just in case, yeah?

Wartime remodeling based on the Luxury
liner, Kashiwara Maru. The renovated
appearance is the aircraft carrier, Jun'you.
I fought properly, and survived until the end.
Ain't I surprisingly capable?
92.26: Ready to go, ready to go!

92.5: A new friend has come. Let's have a party.

I don't want to get close to that... I hope.
93.27: You're making Oboro stronger? I see~
93.29: Admiral, I'm waiting here... I'm waiting here, hey!... Yes.
93.5: A new comrade? I don't really care...
93.6: A ship has returned from the dock.
93.6547: Fall, huh... It's a pretty tranquil season. Admiral, what kind of books do you read?
93.7: The fleet is back, I wonder what the result is?
93.9: You're making Oboro stronger? I see.
93.Anniversary 6547: Admiral. Seems like it's our third anniversary today. I think...yeah, as for me, Oboro feels great today. Yup!
93.Rainy 6547: It's the rainy season, isn't it? Rain... it's nice to have once in a while. It calms me. I believe...
93.Summer 12: Ah....I finally get to wear my swimsuit, and then this.... It's alright, it'll be fixed if I take a bath.... P-probably.
93.Summer 13: It's finally time for some summertime battles! The Seventh Destroyer Division will give it our all.
93.Summer 1471: Hm? This crab? Yes, she's doing well.
93.Summer 6547: Admiral. The summer season is finally here! The Seventh Destroyer Division is fully prepared for the summer practice!

94.1: Ayanami-class Destroyer 'Sazanami',\nMaster. You write it like this, but read\nit as 'Sazanami'.
94.10: Sazanami is a little grateful, just a little.
94.12: Ah~ I've really done it this time too... Oh, that's wrong?
94.21: Guh... I've got nothing to say~
94.22: Sunk~... in the end at least this... is real...
94.23: Everyone thinks I'm just playing around, but well, a bit of effort is amazing, yeah?
94.24: Welcome back, Master~! What? Eh, Admiral, your serious face... what? W-what? Eeeeh?
94.25:
Special-type destroyer number 19, 9th of
the Ayanami-class, Sazanami. It's hard to
read? Only you don't know that character,
you know. I was with the Nagumo Task Force
when Pearl Harbour was burbling, and
headed off to bombard Midway. Wasn't that
unexpectedly cool?
94.29: Master? Sazanami has has nothing to do... It's okay if you pay attention to her~... Wait, ( #゜Д゜) you're ignoring me!
94.4: Master! If I get carried away, I'll send you flying!♪
94.6547: *sigh* Fall, huh. Somehow all my motivation is draining away. Master, gimme a shoulder massage, will you?
94.7: The fleet has returned quickly, hasn't it?
94.8: Master, letter♪ Is it a bill?
94.Rainy 6547: Teru teru bozu? Oh, I've made some. See, ain't they cute? There's one for you, Master, and another for me!
94.Summer 12: Ah~ geez! My swimsuit got rekt! That's totally lame~. I'm gonna take a bath!
94.Summer 4: Hm? Sazanami's swimsuit is pretty good, isn't it? Hm-hmm! You can look more if you want!
94.Summer 6547: Summer's finally here! It's still early? Whatever! It's fine! A bit early is better, you know!

95.1: I'm Asashio, a destroyer.\nI'm always ready for a battle.
95.10: For destroyer gear, this is well-made.
95.11: Even minor damage can prove fatal in the wrong situation.
95.12: It'll be fine. I'll be ready in time for the next battle.
95.18: Closing in on the enemy. One shot, one kill!
95.22: To attack me when I'm on a rescue operation... coward...!
95.23: I'm happy we completed the operation. This is the power of an Asashio-class Destroyer.
95.24: Admiral, what is it? To call me out to such a place... just the two of us... Ah, this is... a strategy meeting, isn't it!
95.25:
Nameship for the Asashio-class
destroyers, Asashio. Made as a
balanced ship, to work on the front
lines. My improved form became the
Kagerou-class, you know.
95.28: U-um... this may be presumptuous coming from me, however... I've always had the utmost respect for you!
95.3: Sir! I'm always available for a sortie.
95.4: Commander, is that a new type of code?
95.5: A new ship has been built.
95.6547: Commander... summer has passed... fall is coming. Don't worry! Us Asashio-class destroyers will go all-out in fall as well! You don't have to worry one bit!
95.Rainy 6547: Commander! The rainy days continue! Would you like the eighth Destroyer Division to start on a teru teru bozu production mission!?
95.Summer 6547: Commander, it's summer! Would you like a chilled ramune from the canteen? Just give me the order!!

96.1: Destroyer class, Ooshio! A small body\nwith large torpedoes! Leave it to me.
96.10: Uoooo! I've been versioned up in a lot of ways!
96.12: Uuahh... I lost. I really lost~...
96.14: Leave the torpedo warfare to me!
96.20: I'll find a way to survive!
96.22: Oh no... I guess... this is my limit...
96.23: Commander! Please tell me if you have any problem. I'll always be there for you!
96.24: Do you know the meaning of 'Ooshio'? It's when the gravitational pull of the moon draws the waves up. In short, it's when there's a moon overhead.
96.25:
Second of the Asashio-class destroyers,
Ooshio! After being sent into the frontlines,
I've mobilized to Guadalcanal for
evacuation missions three times.
I'll support you!
96.27: Hauuu~ being reinforced is so heartwarming.
96.28: Commander, how've you been? Have you become rich?
96.3: Hey, hey, we're only just getting started!
96.4: Yeah, yeah, that feeling! Let's get fired up!
96.5: New friends just keep appearing, don't they?
96.6547: Commander! Fall has arrived! The Eighth Destroyer Division will now gather dry leaves and commence our operation, "bake sweet potatoes"! Naturally, I'm also fired up for fall!
96.9: Hauuu~ being reinforced is so heartwarming.
96.Rainy 6547: You're asking if it's hard to get fired up during the rainy season? No way, not even a little! I'm always fired up!
96.Summer 6547: Commander, the burning summer is here! The Eighth Destroyer Division is also eating shaved ice to get fired up! *brain freeze*

97.1: Michishio here. Why did I get\nassigned to such a fleet?
97.10: W-what is it, did you mean to patronize me?
97.11: Like this, it's too early to be docked.
97.12: Getting the fleet wiped out while I'm being repaired or the likes, don't do that.
97.14: It's ridiculous if I don't sortie.
97.18: How foolish, what lies ahead is hell.
97.21: You did something interesting, huh. I'll return it twice over!
97.23: Don't go planning boring operation, tch!
97.24: I've gotten better at fighting since the beginning, haven't I?... I don't hate it.
97.25:
I'm a destroyer, Michishio. I and my
sisters Asashio, Ooshio, and Arashio
were somehow assigned to the 8th
destroyer squadron. But, we were
separated in the end. Finally I broke into
Leyte, as a member of Nishimura fleet.
97.27: Aa, that's right, you meant to say that my power alone is not enough!
97.28: Reeaaally! This squadron is really lukewarm huh? We're not playing friendly, you know! ...I'm also a friend you say...? I-It's not like I'm happy about it...
97.29: If we're going, then go. If we're not, then don't. Please do it properly! Geez...
97.4: What is it? I don't get what you mean.
97.5: A new ship is ready. Take a look?
97.6: They said that the repair is complete.
97.6547: Fall... huh. This season is a little depressing. Huh? Say what, Commander? It's not like I wanted to be consoled or anything... I'm fine!
97.9: Aa, that's right, you meant to say that my power alone is not enough!
97.EarlySummer 6547: It's slowly getting hotter... it's almost summer... Eh? A swimsuit? Huh?! Of course I don't need one! What are you saying?!
97.Rainy 6547: It's raining quite a bit. Well, watching these rainy days go by isn't bad for once. Oh, please don't use my umbrella without permission. I have it marked with a seal.
97.Summer 6547: It's midsummer. Every day is so hot. Eh? I should wear a swimsuit... you said? Huh?! What are you talking about? Are you trying to get me killed?! Idiot!

98.1: Oh, I haven't introduced myself yet, have I?\nMy name is Arashio.
98.10: Oh my, what a wonderful thing to do.
98.11: I'll take my leave for just a little.
98.12: Oh my, how troublesome. I've taken a quite the damage.
98.14: I'll go on a rampage now~
98.18: I told you there's no escape, right?
98.2: Ufufu, not done with the resupply yet?
98.22: Oh my... you've sunk me... you'll regret this...
98.23: The goddess of victory is right here~ Catch me quickly~
98.24: Ufufufufufu. Though I'm quite persistent, am I also quite resistent, I wonder...
98.25:
I'm the Kobe girl destroyer.
Yes, I'm Arashio.
My sisters and I worked hard in a lot of
places. The only thing is, I really do
dislike having my smokestack destroyed
by bombers.
98.28: Everybody admires the admiral, you know? That Michishio, she really does, no? Ufufufufu.
98.29: Oh... has Arashio been forgotten, I wonder? How troubling...
98.3: I'm looking forward for the next operation~
98.4: Rather than that, isn't that the enemy's plane?
98.6547: Ehehe. So it's fall, huh...? Fall makes me feel just a liiittle bit sad... but... I'm not worried! ...You're so sure kind... ehehehe!
98.Rainy 6547: The rainy days keep coming. Plip plip... plip plip... ufufu. Rainy days are fun because they're rainy, aren't they?
98.Summer 6547: Ufufufu! Little by little, it's been getting so hot lately~... Summer is coming around again~ Summer~! Ufufufu! How exciting~!

99.12: I almost thought I was going to die there, kuma~!
99.14: Choosing Kuma is a good choice, kuma.
99.21: For Kuma to be damaged to this point... what a disgrace, kuma...
99.22: Kuma did what she could, but... this is the end kuma....
99.23: I'm often told that I am an unexpectedly excellent Kuma-chan, kuma.
99.24: Fufufu~ I've caught the admiral, kuma. I'm not gonna let you go, kuma. Kumakuma~!
99.25: First ship of the Kuma-class light cruisers,\nKuma kuma. Born in Sasebo kuma. I got\nsome old parts, but I'll try my best, kumaa.
99.28: Admiral, thanks for you hard work kuma. Taking a break from time-to-time is good, kuma.
99.29: Ku~…ma~… it, it's not like I'm bored, Kuma. I'm enjoying this fully, Kuma!
99.4: Don't pat me, kuma. I'm not a teddy bear, kuma~
99.5: A new ship has been made, kuma~.
99.7: Mission complete. Do you want to see the report, kuma?
99.Anniversary 6547: It's the bearry unexpected third anniversary. I can't bearlieve it, But it bears a celebration! Ku-ma~!
99.Rainy 6547: I hate the rainy season, kuma. Kuuuumaaaa... kuuuumaaaa... Aah! I hate the rain, kuma. Kuuuumaaaa...
99.Summer 6547: It's summer! I'm going swimming, kumaaa. Watch Kuma's river-swimming technique, kuma. I'll paw up some salmon too, kuma~. Ah... that was a joke, kuma.

npc.1: I'm looking forward to working with you.
npc.3: Thank you for your hard work.
npc.301: Keep up the good work, Admiral!
npc.303: So, which piece of equipment do you want to improve?
npc.304: Right now, you can improve these pieces of equipment.
npc.308: Looks good! The improvement was successful!
npc.309: I'm sorry... I couldn't improve it...
npc.310: It's possible to upgrade this equipment into something better!
npc.312: Welcome. How may I help you?
npc.313: So it's gonna be this one?
npc.314: Are you sure you want this?
npc.317: Thanks for your continued support, Admiral!
npc.318: Please try out Large Ship Construction when you have enough resources and materials to spare!
npc.402: As expected of you, Admiral. The operation was a success!
npc.406: What would you like to do?
npc.407: Admiral, please carry out these operations.
npc.408: Admiral, the time has come to move on to a new operation.
